commit_message:
Transform sample_cnt type to int

Duration is seconds from current time, and sample_cnt on
the basis of duration. So sample_cnt always not a int, but
we need sample_cnt as a int type.

Closes-Bug:#1330330

Change-Id: I89e1768523384e24c3a0b8b76f4fa04a123248f9
(cherry picked from commit 2866266a5448b7c49ca8988f82f22b25192e6e16)

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2015-03-12 16:19:14.000000000', 'files': ['glance/async/flows/convert.py', 'glance/async/flows/base_import.py', 'glance/tests/unit/async/flows/test_convert.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Basic support for image conversion

This patch adds a task for image conversion. It uses `qemu-img` to
convert images. This tool has support for several image formats.

The current implementation converts images if and only if the operator
has configured glance to do so. That is, the `convert_to_format` option
has been set.

There are few things about this patch that should be improved by
follow-up patches. The first one is the fact that it relies on the
entry_points order for task execution. Although this works, it is not
the most flexible/controllable way to do it. The second thing is that it
relies on the aforementioned configuration option to enable/disable the
task (as in, it becomes a non-op). There should be an explicit way to
enable/disable tasks.

Since both things mentioned in the previous paragraph affect the task
management in general, I've decided to leave the fix for a follow-up
patch.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Partially-implements blueprint: new-upload-workflow
Partially-implements blueprint: basic-import-conversion

Change-Id: I0196a6f327c0147f897ae051ee60a8cb11b8fd40
"}]
commit_message:
Basic support for image conversion

This patch adds a task for image conversion. It uses `qemu-img` to
convert images. This tool has support for several image formats.

The current implementation converts images if and only if the operator
has configured glance to do so. That is, the `convert_to_format` option
has been set.

There are few things about this patch that should be improved by
follow-up patches. The first one is the fact that it relies on the
entry_points order for task execution. Although this works, it is not
the most flexible/controllable way to do it. The second thing is that it
relies on the aforementioned configuration option to enable/disable the
task (as in, it becomes a non-op). There should be an explicit way to
enable/disable tasks.

Since both things mentioned in the previous paragraph affect the task
management in general, I've decided to leave the fix for a follow-up
patch.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Partially-implements blueprint: new-upload-workflow
Partially-implements blueprint: basic-import-conversion

Change-Id: I0196a6f327c0147f897ae051ee60a8cb11b8fd40

commit_message:
Implements whitelist and blacklist mapping rules

Adds whitelist and blacklist rules to allow passing through a list of
groups from the IdP, after filtering them according to either of these
rules.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Partially-Implements: bp mapping-enhancements
Change-Id: I4592ba1c05e99c16645b5303c0192fc462b474aa

This patch adds engine_id and atomic_key column to the resource
table for locking the resource and making all operations atomic.
Also added the db api to update the resource table.

The engine which updates the db first, gets the lock on the
resource. Only updates with this engine are possible. Updates with
other engine will not go through as they will fail to find the
matching record in the db.

Implements: blueprint convergence-resource-locking
'}]
commit_message:
DB changes for resource locking

This patch adds engine_id and atomic_key column to the resource
table for locking the resource and making all operations atomic.
Also added the db api to update the resource table.

The engine which updates the db first, gets the lock on the
resource. Only updates with this engine are possible. Updates with
other engine will not go through as they will fail to find the
matching record in the db.

Change-Id: Id8c3df7a439347652d3feca7481cd72762bf30ea
Implements: blueprint convergence-resource-locking

The min_count, max_count, and security_groups parameters for

commit_message:
Add missing servers.create parameter documentation

The min_count, max_count, and security_groups parameters for
servers.create are missing documentation. The security_groups
parameter was documented in the servers._boot function but that
private function isn't published to the docs.

This change adds the missing documentation for the aforementioned
parameters and removes the duplicate docs in the servers._boot
function.

Change-Id: Ib0dcc7e8f7f4d0b83b6caeddd1ace66add4e0003

commit_message:
Fixes alignment of pencil icon in Users Table

When cell is empty (e.g. in the email column), the edit pencil icon gets
shifted down and not centered. This patch makes the pencil icon centered
for all the cases.

Change-Id: I5a344449e496e73f2a0679a6206e4c35747afb0f
Closes-bug: #1419204

commit_message:
Adding utf8 to federation tables

Tables have to be in utf8 for the migration utility
to work properly. This fixes the UTF8 issues with the
federation tables in-line and should be able to be
backported. A subsequent change to handle sanity checks
in a more sane way (post migrations) will be implemented
going forward.

Change-Id: Id68c3f307f53b6a4de011e2608d899d044aced68
Closes-Bug: 1426334

Glance basic architecture section

Adds a basic architecture description section

This patch is a follow up to the multiattach patch that adds
the ability to the scheduler to be able to filter capabilities
on the volume multiattach flag.   When a volume creation request
comes in with the multiattach flag set on a volume, there was no
way to filter out backends that don't support attaching a volume
to more than one host.   By defaut, no host supports it.  When

Change-Id: Ia426a2bf2ab8214f52fb6e70a3a1deff68d13d98

commit_message:
Add multiattach capabilities injection

This patch is a follow up to the multiattach patch that adds
the ability to the scheduler to be able to filter capabilities
on the volume multiattach flag.   When a volume creation request
comes in with the multiattach flag set on a volume, there was no
way to filter out backends that don't support attaching a volume
to more than one host.   By defaut, no host supports it.  When
The Nova side lands, we can adjust drivers to add the new
multiattach:True capability reporting.

Change-Id: Ia426a2bf2ab8214f52fb6e70a3a1deff68d13d98

commit_message:
Add InstanceList.get_all method

As part of the effort to remove direct DB calls from the Scheduler
filters, there needs to be a method for getting an InstanceList object
containing all the instances available.

Partially-Implements: blueprint isolate-scheduler-db
(https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/isolate-scheduler-db)

Change-Id: Ie5e0e4f2dbb46da5df91067cfe90de366fc9adc9

subject: Create DIB elements for HP Vertica on Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-03-12 16:26:23.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-vertica/README.md', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-vertica/install.d/97-vertica', 'scripts/functions_qemu', 'scripts/redstack', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-vertica/extra-data.d/93-copy-vertica-deb'], 'message': 'Create DIB elements for HP Vertica on Ubuntu

A specification for this change was submitted for review in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151126/

Changes:
- Creates the disk-image-builder elements for
  installing HP Vertica on Ubuntu.

- Introduces new env variables DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION which
  specifies location to look for package installer file.

- It would be the job of elements(extra-data.d) to discover
  existence of DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION, and notify appropriate
  error message in case of non-existent DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION.

To execute kick-start for Vertica, user has to download
Vertica package from https://my.vertica.com and place
file at DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION and update the value of
DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION to point to actual package-file.

For eg.
if package file-name is vertica.deb and it is placed in /tmp,
then to run kick-start proceed as follows:

  $ export DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION=/tmp/vertica.deb
  $ ./redstack kick-start vertica

Partially Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Change-Id: Ibc64b42eb5d2f4722eb27a7bc730dda98014347f
'}]
commit_message:
Create DIB elements for HP Vertica on Ubuntu

A specification for this change was submitted for review in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151126/

Changes:
- Creates the disk-image-builder elements for
  installing HP Vertica on Ubuntu.

- Introduces new env variables DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION which
  specifies location to look for package installer file.

- It would be the job of elements(extra-data.d) to discover
  existence of DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION, and notify appropriate
  error message in case of non-existent DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION.

To execute kick-start for Vertica, user has to download
Vertica package from https://my.vertica.com and place
file at DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION and update the value of
DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION to point to actual package-file.

For eg.
if package file-name is vertica.deb and it is placed in /tmp,
then to run kick-start proceed as follows:

  $ export DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION=/tmp/vertica.deb
  $ ./redstack kick-start vertica

Partially Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Change-Id: Ibc64b42eb5d2f4722eb27a7bc730dda98014347f

subject: Restructure the in-memory node usage
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-12 18:13:18.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_memory.py'], 'message': 'Restructure the in-memory node usage

Instead of retaining full paths only retain
partial paths; this then allows for finding
a parent node and then easily finding a child
by using the find() routines.

This more naturally emulates a real filesystem
using our tree structure and simplifies certain
operations to make them more efficient/simple.

Change-Id: I207b02c979704a15eac8be46d11a0af61b05d9b9
'}]
commit_message:
Restructure the in-memory node usage

Instead of retaining full paths only retain
partial paths; this then allows for finding
a parent node and then easily finding a child
by using the find() routines.

This more naturally emulates a real filesystem
using our tree structure and simplifies certain
operations to make them more efficient/simple.

Change-Id: I207b02c979704a15eac8be46d11a0af61b05d9b9

commit_message:
Bring EC API calls in sync with PyECLib 1.0

Changes in PyECLib 1.0:

  * All PyECLib exceptions consolidated into one (ECDriverError)
    with improved error handling
  * Uses liberasurecode-provided EC backends
    (some semantic/error reporting changes)
  * EC backend names brought in sync with liberasurecode
    (flat_xor_3 -> flat_xor_hd_3,
     flat_xor_4 -> flat_xor_hd_4,
     jerasure_rs_cauchy_orig -> jerasure_rs_cauchy)

Change-Id: I941541f8043c8a4851815df654e467d42f00c357

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-04 17:08:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/278_unique_compute_node_hypervisor_hostname.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Ensure a hypervisor is only managed by a single compute host

Nova does not support a hypervisor managed by more than 1 compute
host. This change makes that lack of support explicit by causing Nova
to raise an exception when attempting to create a compute node which
violates it. If the compute driver reports all nodes at startup, as
the VMware driver does, and Ironic can do, this will cause a
misconfigured Nova to fail to start. This is preferrable to allowing
the system to run, which will require manual cleanup and may result in
data loss.

Specifically, if the compute driver reports a hypervisor node from
get_available_nodes(), Nova assumes that all instances associated with
that node will also have the same compute host. This assumption is
pervasive, and violating it breaks a large number of things. The bug
below notes that the evacuation cleanup code will cause all instances
running on the hypervisor to be erroneously deleted. It will also
prevent all periodic tasks from running correctly.

There are currently only 2 drivers which report a hypervisor identity
different to the compute host: VMware and Ironic. No other drivers
are affected by this change.

Note that this change is not related to support for multiple
hypervisors per compute host. It relates to a single hypervisor being
accidentally managed by multiple compute hosts, which is not
supported.

Closes-Bug: #1419785
Change-Id: I48c2331e66532cd043da8aecdb8e7649776e836a
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure a hypervisor is only managed by a single compute host

Nova does not support a hypervisor managed by more than 1 compute
host. This change makes that lack of support explicit by causing Nova
to raise an exception when attempting to create a compute node which
violates it. If the compute driver reports all nodes at startup, as
the VMware driver does, and Ironic can do, this will cause a
misconfigured Nova to fail to start. This is preferrable to allowing
the system to run, which will require manual cleanup and may result in
data loss.

Specifically, if the compute driver reports a hypervisor node from
get_available_nodes(), Nova assumes that all instances associated with
that node will also have the same compute host. This assumption is
pervasive, and violating it breaks a large number of things. The bug
below notes that the evacuation cleanup code will cause all instances
running on the hypervisor to be erroneously deleted. It will also
prevent all periodic tasks from running correctly.

There are currently only 2 drivers which report a hypervisor identity
different to the compute host: VMware and Ironic. No other drivers
are affected by this change.

Note that this change is not related to support for multiple
hypervisors per compute host. It relates to a single hypervisor being
accidentally managed by multiple compute hosts, which is not
supported.

Closes-Bug: #1419785
Change-Id: I48c2331e66532cd043da8aecdb8e7649776e836a

"}]
commit_message:
Log stdout from build_wheels in cache_devstack

This commit adds a print statement with the stdout from the run_local()
call which executes build_wheels.sh in devstack. Right now when the
script is executed all it does is print that it's running but we are
unable to debug anything that could potentially go wrong during the
execution of the script without the output from build_wheels.

Change-Id: I7433f054127a42fa73598db219c6e351efc98fb7

commit_message:
Update latest modules from oslo-incubator

Updates the _i18n, versionutils, and install_venv_common
modules to the latest from oslo-incubator. The other modules
listed in openstack-common.conf (lockutils, log, importlib, and
fixture) could not be found because they are not part of
oslo-incubator anymore. The log module was updated by hand to
fix a bug, but it and the other deprecated modules should be
replaced with the appropriate substitutions.

Change-Id: I14a7a31e7208a9dc5dbd5686fbeab824b455ffa8
Partial-Bug: 1430124

commit_message:
Make dependency on boto entirely conditional

By moving the import into the (only) method that needs boto.exception we
retain the ability to list the options from that driver without breaking
glance_store.backend.register_opts.

Closes-bug: 1426767
Change-Id: Ie35b4b41f71b79502cb2d4b83c2037ec0d798557

commit_message:
Temporary fix for being able to load neutron_lbaas.conf

This bug prevents neutron_lbaas.conf from being loaded and
we need this file to be loaded to gain access to the config options.
This is just a temporary solution and should immediately be undone
once a fix for the bug has been commited to neutron.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1430153

Change-Id: Idcdd09006613b77847d8fc83c2225ad3b0540c13

commit_message:
lazy loading for logbooks and flowdetails

You can now specify a "lazy" argument when asking a
persistence backend for a logbook for flowdetail.
This will return a logbook with no flowdetails in it,
or a flowdetail with no atomdetails in it, respectively.

Change-Id: Ie81a19a2107b44e2c35c2a92507bec03eee55c50

commit_message:
Remove useless policy rules for v2.1 api which removed/disabled

Because V2.1 must be identical with V2 and must not contain any new
attributes and new method. So the swap/attach/deatch in extend_volume
was removed.  But there still left some policy rules related to it.
This patch cleanup them.

Change-Id: I6e7e3263261519f72fa6b067db6a5930026f02dd

subject: Allow injected atom args to be persisted
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-03-11 17:32:00.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/base.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'doc/source/engines.rst', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/runtime.py'], 'message': 'Allow injected atom args to be persisted

Instead of only storing injected atom arguments in memory
allow for specifying those to be persisted; so that users
who desire this feature can persist them (it defaults to
being transient to retain the old API behavior).

This also reworks the validating of engine dependencies
to be more correct. It removes the validation of these
dependencies from the prepare() method and moves them to a
new engine validate() method; this allows users to prepare()
the engine, then inject there atom non-transient arguments
and then validate(); the validation would fail prior to this
at preparation time since no injected arguments would
exist and the user would not have the ability to inject any
that target a specific atom, since the atom detail would
not have been created yet (since that is populated in the
prepartion method).

Change-Id: I2846d0334db32a115592f850d85b206d9e6a3f07
'}]
commit_message:
Allow injected atom args to be persisted

Instead of only storing injected atom arguments in memory
allow for specifying those to be persisted; so that users
who desire this feature can persist them (it defaults to
being transient to retain the old API behavior).

This also reworks the validating of engine dependencies
to be more correct. It removes the validation of these
dependencies from the prepare() method and moves them to a
new engine validate() method; this allows users to prepare()
the engine, then inject there atom non-transient arguments
and then validate(); the validation would fail prior to this
at preparation time since no injected arguments would
exist and the user would not have the ability to inject any
that target a specific atom, since the atom detail would
not have been created yet (since that is populated in the
prepartion method).

Change-Id: I2846d0334db32a115592f850d85b206d9e6a3f07

To make it easier to provide just a connection string to the

simplify the interaction with this function.

Change-Id: I59cd330c545985fe9782c3049690425ead1c8cf3
"}]
commit_message:
Allow backend connection config (via fetch) to be a string

To make it easier to provide just a connection string to the
persistence backend fetch mechanism (without needing to create
a dictionary with just a 'connection' key) match the behavior
of the other fetch-like functions and accept a string to
simplify the interaction with this function.

Change-Id: I59cd330c545985fe9782c3049690425ead1c8cf3

commit_message:
Use ordered[set/dict] to retain ordering

Instead of using always using a set/dict which do not retain
use a ordered set and a ordered dict for requires, optional,
and provides and rebind mappings types so that the ordering
of these containers is maintained later when they are used.

These ordering can be useful depending on the atom type (such
as in a map and reduce tasks).

Partial-Bug: 1357117

Change-Id: I365d11bbba4aa221bc36ca15441acecf199b4d56

commit_message:
Add support for identity_uri.

This patch adds the ability to set a new keystone_identity_uri
parameter.  It also deprecates the old keystone_host, keystone_port,
keystone_protocol, and keystone_auth_admin_prefix parameters. Logic
is in place so that users of the deprecated settings should have a
smooth upgrade process and get deprecation warnings until they adopt
the new settings.

Change-Id: Ideefb4d824cbd5b4b83f9eb773a75e536e3458fb

subject: Manila cDOT driver should use loopingcall for ASUP report timing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-10 16:11:16.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_base.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/test_lib_base.py'], 'message': 'Manila cDOT driver should use loopingcall for ASUP report timing

The Manila cDOT driver uses its own timing code called from
get_share_stats() to do ASUP logging.  The periodic ASUP task
should instead be controlled by an independent loopingcall task.
This simplifies the driver and better separates code paths that
are unrelated and should run separately.

Change-Id: Ia3deda9415ecb2c026d4e91d047c8611b8432674
Closes-Bug: #1429972
'}]
commit_message:
Manila cDOT driver should use loopingcall for ASUP report timing

The Manila cDOT driver uses its own timing code called from
get_share_stats() to do ASUP logging.  The periodic ASUP task
should instead be controlled by an independent loopingcall task.
This simplifies the driver and better separates code paths that
are unrelated and should run separately.

Change-Id: Ia3deda9415ecb2c026d4e91d047c8611b8432674
Closes-Bug: #1429972

commit_message:
Don't add exception instance in LOG.exception

LOG.exception will print out the full stacktrace, that's enough.
We should only record meaningful message.

Change-Id: I8b5c581717e6b78c11c46e226463927450c9f287

This stackforge project will host an ML2 mechanism driver relying on
bagpipe-bgp to implement Neutron networks with E-VPN.

Note that this patch intentionally adds a group 'bagpipe-l2' to
gerrit/projects.yaml, to map to the launchpad group at
https://launchpad.net/bagpipe-l2 .

Change-Id: Ib85f6247ae9ea2e29febe6cf39e7c2f224216159
"}]
commit_message:
Add networking-bagpipe-l2 project

This stackforge project will host an ML2 mechanism driver relying on
bagpipe-bgp to implement Neutron networks with E-VPN.

Note that this patch intentionally adds a group 'bagpipe-l2' to
gerrit/projects.yaml, to map to the launchpad group at
https://launchpad.net/bagpipe-l2 .

Change-Id: Ib85f6247ae9ea2e29febe6cf39e7c2f224216159

subject: Fix infinite recursion caused by unnecessary stub
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-12 04:16:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_v3_auth.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_auth.py'], 'message': "Fix infinite recursion caused by unnecessary stub

The auth tests used a stub to alter `nova.RequestContext` to become
`FakeRequestContext`. The problem with this is that `FakeRequestContext`
inherits from `nova.RequestContext` which has the effect of making
`FakeRequestContext` point to itself for it's parent class.

This leads to infinite recursion if a context object is created after this
stub is set.

This code has worked up until now because no tests have created a new context
after this stub was set. Downstream patches, however, may end up creating a
context here, so we should fix this.

It turns out that this stub isn't necessary, so deleting it entirely is
sufficient to fix the issue and keep tests passing.

Closes-Bug: 1431022

Change-Id: I6969dc2759ff2dbb78de831dbd40ea24cc3840ad
"}]
commit_message:
Fix infinite recursion caused by unnecessary stub

The auth tests used a stub to alter `nova.RequestContext` to become
`FakeRequestContext`. The problem with this is that `FakeRequestContext`
inherits from `nova.RequestContext` which has the effect of making
`FakeRequestContext` point to itself for it's parent class.

This leads to infinite recursion if a context object is created after this
stub is set.

This code has worked up until now because no tests have created a new context
after this stub was set. Downstream patches, however, may end up creating a
context here, so we should fix this.

It turns out that this stub isn't necessary, so deleting it entirely is
sufficient to fix the issue and keep tests passing.

Closes-Bug: 1431022

Change-Id: I6969dc2759ff2dbb78de831dbd40ea24cc3840ad

commit_message:
Improve 'attach interface' exception handling

Previously, if a user attempted to launch an instance and specified a
port that belonged to a different tenant, a HTTP 500 Server
Error was returned to the user. This patch changes that to a
more informative HTTPBadRequest exception.

Change-Id: I4a4017407ac7358490974cbffc5b7dbb7a200f44
Closes-bug: #1409617

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-09 16:02:42.000000000', 'files': ['designate/exceptions.py', 'designate/objects/adapters/api_v1/__init__.py', 'designate/objects/adapters/api_v2/__init__.py', 'designate/objects/adapters/api_v2/base.py', 'designate/objects/adapters/api_v1/base.py', 'designate/objects/adapters/__init__.py', 'designate/tests/test_objects/test_adapters.py', 'designate/objects/adapters/base.py'], 'message': "Create DesignateAdapter and surrounding infrastructure

This implements the basic infrastructure for DesignateAdapter
and creates the basis for the API v2/v1 Adapter objects

These will replace views in both the v1 and v2 APIs, and allow for the
validation of API requests to move into the DesignateObjects themselves.

Example use is

   zone = central.get_domain(blah)
   DesignateAdapter.render('API_v1', zone)
   // Returns v1 dict, ready to	convert to JSON

These objects have a registry of sorts, so all calls will be made to
DesignateAdapter, and the combination of the format param ('API_v1' in
this case) will load the right Adapter and return the right JSON ready
dict.

Change-Id: I2b77205751675de600248180fafbfe22a2c1d8f5
Blueprint: validation-cleanup
"}]
commit_message:
Create DesignateAdapter and surrounding infrastructure

This implements the basic infrastructure for DesignateAdapter
and creates the basis for the API v2/v1 Adapter objects

These will replace views in both the v1 and v2 APIs, and allow for the
validation of API requests to move into the DesignateObjects themselves.

Example use is

   zone = central.get_domain(blah)
   DesignateAdapter.render('API_v1', zone)
   // Returns v1 dict, ready to	convert to JSON

These objects have a registry of sorts, so all calls will be made to
DesignateAdapter, and the combination of the format param ('API_v1' in
this case) will load the right Adapter and return the right JSON ready
dict.

Change-Id: I2b77205751675de600248180fafbfe22a2c1d8f5
Blueprint: validation-cleanup

commit_message:
EMC Isilon Manila driver

The Isilon Manila driver supports the following functionalities:
* Create/delete NFS/CIFS share
* Create/delete snapshot
* Allow/deny access to share
* Create share from snapshot

implements: blueprint emc-isilon-manila-driver

Change-Id: If5f064751120890afba0571bc2b407d141ba0323

commit_message:
Language pack does not return source_uri during creation

After a language pack is created, the source uri is not displayed
by the CLI on create. Subsequent calls to show the language pack do.

Change-Id: Idc1f3f529fe8da4b99de743759ae1da3dc116596
Closes-bug: 1430927

commit_message:
Add Information on Disabling Root Wrapper

Updating the Admin Guide and with the doc impact information from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150904/: If root wrapper performance
becomes deficient or inadequate, this configuration disables root wrapper,
and adds a sudo only fallback.

Change-Id: Id583a03f02dd2730b87588e9f9defd19739f719c
backport: none
Closes-Bug: #1415747

subject: Add ro level of access support to generic driver
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-11 20:57:08.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/test_generic.py', 'manila/share/drivers/generic.py', 'manila/exception.py'], 'message': 'Add ro level of access support to generic driver

Recently was added funtionality of rw/ro level of access to API.
Implement its support with NFS protocol for Generic driver and raise
error for CIFS protocol if it is not rw, because it does not allow
to handle both - ro and rw access rules for IPs/nets using one share export.

Implements BP generic-driver-ro-access

Change-Id: Iec7c01790bade6d4ce2f50b5a691e563dd756aa5
'}]
commit_message:
Add ro level of access support to generic driver

Recently was added funtionality of rw/ro level of access to API.
Implement its support with NFS protocol for Generic driver and raise
error for CIFS protocol if it is not rw, because it does not allow
to handle both - ro and rw access rules for IPs/nets using one share export.

Implements BP generic-driver-ro-access

Change-Id: Iec7c01790bade6d4ce2f50b5a691e563dd756aa5

subject: NetApp cDOT driver should not create useless export-policy rule
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-10 18:50:48.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/protocols/test_nfs_cmode.py', 'manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/protocols/nfs_cmode.py'], 'message': 'NetApp cDOT driver should not create useless export-policy rule

When using manila with a cDOT backend, the 'manila create' command
creates an export-policy for every newly created NFS share and adds
a policy rule with "localhost".  This is not necessary.

Change-Id: If4b54255328ed7384a195609d7e4e99c79d10638
Closes-Bug: #1427791
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver should not create useless export-policy rule

When using manila with a cDOT backend, the 'manila create' command
creates an export-policy for every newly created NFS share and adds
a policy rule with "localhost".  This is not necessary.

Change-Id: If4b54255328ed7384a195609d7e4e99c79d10638
Closes-Bug: #1427791

commit_message:
Add keystone docker-compose file.

To follow the model of container sets, net will be set to
host so that containers will not need to be linked together.

All enviroment variables will come from 'openstack.env'.

Co-authored-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ifdb0f146ff82c0fedb09255f6e1955ecdc435444

commit_message:
provisioning rabbitmq via userdata/cloud-init

- changed create cluster flows from a combination of unordered and
  linear flows to a graph flow
- added userdata generation step to create userdata to be used by
  each VM
- added check_or_restart_rabbitmq, to check rabbitmq status a
  number of times then restart the VM, before checking again

Change-Id: I98f2aa031ccd7e8bb068fa4cece3dd8af263e33e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8592, 'name': 'Anastasia Kuznetsova', 'email': 'akuznetsova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nastya-kuz'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9432, 'name': 'Dmitri Zimine', 'email': 'dz@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'dzimine'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14509, 'name': 'Pierre Mathieu', 'email': 'pierre-arthur.mathieu@hpe.com', 'username': 'slashme'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-19 12:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/services/triggers.py', 'mistral/services/periodic.py'], 'message': 'Add oneshot cron trigger

Add the possibility to launch oneshot cron triggers.
Those trigger are only executed once at a given date.

To use them you must specify a special pattern begining with an "@".
"@YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM"

Exemple:
mistral cron-trigger-create test "@2015-02-11 16:18" reboot_server input.json

Once executed, instead of computing the next occurence, the trigger is deleted.

Change-Id: I78f6c9d69fd610475c640074aa22c11a10f9c90f
'}]
commit_message:
Add oneshot cron trigger

Add the possibility to launch oneshot cron triggers.
Those trigger are only executed once at a given date.

To use them you must specify a special pattern begining with an "@".
"@YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM"

Exemple:
mistral cron-trigger-create test "@2015-02-11 16:18" reboot_server input.json

Once executed, instead of computing the next occurence, the trigger is deleted.

Change-Id: I78f6c9d69fd610475c640074aa22c11a10f9c90f

subject: Add Client object to documentation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 00:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/client.py', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Add Client object to documentation

After wanting to do a rather simple thing -- figure out of the
"timeout" argument to nodepool was a int or a float, it lead me down
the rabbit-hole to python-novaclient.

It turns out the timeout does get passed through to requests as a
float so that mystery was solved.

But the "Client" class seems to be missing from the documentation as
it's not included in the class list.  So add that and also at least
document the types of the arguments.

However, then I noticd that this wasn't showing up; turns out sphinx
requires "autoclass_content = both" if you want it to document
__init__() functions.  Several other classes had their init args
documented but they weren't showing up because of this.

Change-Id: I8f44e92f2a0f25a75926b1813a8b374e79b4f5db
'}]
commit_message:
Add Client object to documentation

After wanting to do a rather simple thing -- figure out of the
"timeout" argument to nodepool was a int or a float, it lead me down
the rabbit-hole to python-novaclient.

It turns out the timeout does get passed through to requests as a
float so that mystery was solved.

But the "Client" class seems to be missing from the documentation as
it's not included in the class list.  So add that and also at least
document the types of the arguments.

However, then I noticd that this wasn't showing up; turns out sphinx
requires "autoclass_content = both" if you want it to document
__init__() functions.  Several other classes had their init args
documented but they weren't showing up because of this.

Change-Id: I8f44e92f2a0f25a75926b1813a8b374e79b4f5db

commit_message:
nova client cinder query param changed to display_name

nova client is not able to show the list of volumes when
querying by name.This is because cinder api accepts only
display_name as query parameter and when qeried with 'name'
parameter returns a empty list

Change-Id: Ie4ffc275d1754052d9e239d8457baf6f7fd53b83
Closes-Bug: #1430415

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-20 17:38:09.000000000', 'files': ['manila/network/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'message': 'Remove potential extra work in IpRouteCommand

Variable device_list initialisation and usage is messed up in method
IpRouteCommand.pullup_route. This lead to multiple remove/add same
routes on interface. It's not affect final result, but it do extra work.

By the way, is someone know this method need for? Method's docsting tell
us "Ensures that the route entry for the interface is before all others
on the same subnet." But this is have no sense.

Records in routing table sorted according to destination netmask.  More
specific rules goes first. more common goes last. If someone really need
to change order of records in routing table he should use separate
routing table (See "man ip-route" for info about routing tables and
routing rules. Don't mess routing rules and routing records.)

Change-Id: I35ae4ab9e02a8036d5b823d972c200ce7eaf11c1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove potential extra work in IpRouteCommand

Variable device_list initialisation and usage is messed up in method
IpRouteCommand.pullup_route. This lead to multiple remove/add same
routes on interface. It's not affect final result, but it do extra work.

By the way, is someone know this method need for? Method's docsting tell
us "Ensures that the route entry for the interface is before all others
on the same subnet." But this is have no sense.

Records in routing table sorted according to destination netmask.  More
specific rules goes first. more common goes last. If someone really need
to change order of records in routing table he should use separate
routing table (See "man ip-route" for info about routing tables and
routing rules. Don't mess routing rules and routing records.)

Change-Id: I35ae4ab9e02a8036d5b823d972c200ce7eaf11c1

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-11 01:20:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/wsgi.py', 'etc/neutron.conf'], 'message': "Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections. Hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection. Because of this problem, the green thread is not released
back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Icehouse backport note: socket_timeout was dropped, it was introduced
in 0.14[*] and Icehouse eventlet lower bound is 0.13

[*] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/7d4916f01462de09cb58853d9de2e85777c2ad5b

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1361360
Change-Id: I3a361d6590d1800b85791f23ac1cdfd79815341b
(cherry picked from commit 8e7a0dbb12082f6159d98a4628fb8a6fcd05e95a)
"}]
commit_message:
Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections. Hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection. Because of this problem, the green thread is not released
back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Icehouse backport note: socket_timeout was dropped, it was introduced
in 0.14[*] and Icehouse eventlet lower bound is 0.13

[*] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/7d4916f01462de09cb58853d9de2e85777c2ad5b

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1361360
Change-Id: I3a361d6590d1800b85791f23ac1cdfd79815341b
(cherry picked from commit 8e7a0dbb12082f6159d98a4628fb8a6fcd05e95a)

Update quota multi-value in one request is not an atomicity operation,
so even if a quota is invalid (Ex: ram less than already used), some values
may change but the return code is 400.

Closes-Bug: #1291199

commit_message:
Verify all quotas before updating the db

Update quota multi-value in one request is not an atomicity operation,
so even if a quota is invalid (Ex: ram less than already used), some values
may change but the return code is 400.

This patch will first check all the quotas before hitting the DB.

Change-Id: I22171c1f1f8171c502f2a9d710cfac38f5b38d85
Closes-Bug: #1291199

subject: storage: add support for value research
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-11 13:17:49.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_storage.py'], 'message': 'storage: add support for value research

This allow the driver to provide a method to search for a certain value.
That is useful to look for period where some metrics are over a certain
value, e.g. finding all metrics (and therefore resources) where the CPU
usage is above 80\xa0%.

Change-Id: I0fab7b80424371b1f4d213ce8aecefe353cce1a6
'}]
commit_message:
storage: add support for value research

This allow the driver to provide a method to search for a certain value.
That is useful to look for period where some metrics are over a certain
value, e.g. finding all metrics (and therefore resources) where the CPU
usage is above 80 %.

Change-Id: I0fab7b80424371b1f4d213ce8aecefe353cce1a6

commit_message:
Adjust Cinder to support FCP on System z systems

There are some platform specific changes needed to allow Cinder to
support FCP on System z: the System z specific format of the device file
paths, adding and removing devices explicitely, and ignoring vHBAs which
are offline.

Partial-Implements blueprint linux-systemz

Change-Id: Ia61c37246235bec618de5bb7f718e8b5520bc9ae

This change adds support for iSCSI CHAP with randomly generated
secrets for each initiator. Due to some restrictions with storing meta

from the driver. We will use the driver specific initiator data in the

Change-Id: I5dfc29602a41ed565af074368947c99aafdc0ab8'}]
commit_message:
Add CHAP support to PureISCSIDriver

This change adds support for iSCSI CHAP with randomly generated
secrets for each initiator. Due to some restrictions with storing meta
data in the backend these secrets need to be stored someplace accessible
from the driver. We will use the driver specific initiator data in the
Cinder DB to store them.

Implements: blueprint pure-iscsi-chap-support
Change-Id: I5dfc29602a41ed565af074368947c99aafdc0ab8

commit_message:
Return 404 when executing net-list-on-dhcp-agent with invalid agent_id

Neutron server returns HTTP code 200 when users execute
net-list-on-dhcp-agent with invalid agent_id.
Users expect HTTP code 404 to be returned.

Change-Id: I41652a9bf4a81835abb6646ea870781472757623
Closes-bug: 1425138

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-12 15:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': "Add wwpns to system_metadata for NPIV

NPIV requires that WWPNs be exist on the VM's Fibre Channel adapter.
This change stores the WWPN metadata in the system_metadata (assuming
using the NPIV attach strategy).  This allows for proper
volume_connector rebuilds (which are needed for migrate, destroy,
etc...)

After merge, the destroy path within nova_powervm with NPIV attached
Cinder volumes will work.

Future change sets will add support for aspects such as relocation,
multi I/O Servers, multiple FC ports.

Change-Id: Ie533fa0039ed8b7d7ad8decd21be32ccb23f458e
"}]
commit_message:
Add wwpns to system_metadata for NPIV

NPIV requires that WWPNs be exist on the VM's Fibre Channel adapter.
This change stores the WWPN metadata in the system_metadata (assuming
using the NPIV attach strategy).  This allows for proper
volume_connector rebuilds (which are needed for migrate, destroy,
etc...)

After merge, the destroy path within nova_powervm with NPIV attached
Cinder volumes will work.

Future change sets will add support for aspects such as relocation,
multi I/O Servers, multiple FC ports.

Change-Id: Ie533fa0039ed8b7d7ad8decd21be32ccb23f458e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 20:45:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/console/websocketproxy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py'], 'message': 'Websocket Proxy should verify Origin header

If the Origin HTTP header passed in the WebSocket handshake does
not match the host, this could indicate an attempt at a
cross-site attack.  This commit adds a check to verify
the origin matches the host.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Icda3f8aad0e5dde0be2b12accf03f092634ecde3
Closes-Bug: 1409142
'}]
commit_message:
Websocket Proxy should verify Origin header

If the Origin HTTP header passed in the WebSocket handshake does
not match the host, this could indicate an attempt at a
cross-site attack.  This commit adds a check to verify
the origin matches the host.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Icda3f8aad0e5dde0be2b12accf03f092634ecde3
Closes-Bug: 1409142

commit_message:
Add operation systems list for TestRail reporter

Add possibility to specify what operation system
releases were used during tests while reporting
results to TestRail.
Also add 'Invalid' bug status to the list of
statuses which are considered as closed and
shouldn't be copied to new results.

Change-Id: I9dd707414044699bd3745b860ac160c43d2e1043
Closes-bug: #1430187

commit_message:
Fixed a problem in recreating masking view in VMAX

When two attach requests happen at the same time on the same volume,
the second one will fail. This patch fixed the problem.

Change-Id: I48450d8bdd4e108cdbc5958951dc5225d6a8592f
Closes-Bug: #1403160

This change set provide a simple, single fabric, single FC port
connection for a given Virtual Machine.

This change puts the foundation in (via future change sets) for:
 - Delete connection
 - Multi port
 - Multi I/O Servers

This change does support booting from a NPIV volume.  It does not yet
support delete (though most of the code is in place).  This is due to
the volume connector not generating the same WWPNs.  That needs to be
stored in system metadata, which will be handled in a future change set.

Change-Id: If43f2d6afb56b6c6b6a2265ab0ce18f63d6f9eb4
'}]
commit_message:
NPIV Volume Connection

This change set provide a simple, single fabric, single FC port
connection for a given Virtual Machine.

This change puts the foundation in (via future change sets) for:
 - Delete connection
 - Multi port
 - Multi I/O Servers

This change does support booting from a NPIV volume.  It does not yet
support delete (though most of the code is in place).  This is due to
the volume connector not generating the same WWPNs.  That needs to be
stored in system metadata, which will be handled in a future change set.

Change-Id: If43f2d6afb56b6c6b6a2265ab0ce18f63d6f9eb4

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 8443, 'name': 'Georgy Okrokvertskhov', 'email': 'gokrokvertskhov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gokrokvertskhov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-09 22:26:25.000000000', 'files': ['reference/new-projects-requirements.rst'], 'message': "Add minimal diversity requirement for new projects

In the incubation/graduation model contributor diversity was a
requirement for graduation, since one of the goals of incubation was to
increase contributor diversity.

But with the big tent model, where there are significantly more
projects in OpenStack, and we don't pick 'winners' I don't think its
realistic to assume joining OpenStack guarantees a growth in contributor
diversity.

At the same time one of OpenStack's big attractions is community driven
projects where no single company overwhelmingly dominates.

Instead of the previous diversity requirement (Project must have a large and
diverse team of contributors) and a lower bar to at least make sure new
projects aren't overwhelmingly dominated by a single company.

Note: this raises the bar for projects to join OpenStack, but hopefully
in a way that aligns with the big tent initiative.

Change-Id: I98bbfc590677e4e1a89e4dc0d0c81f7fbd183026
"}]
commit_message:
Add minimal diversity requirement for new projects

In the incubation/graduation model contributor diversity was a
requirement for graduation, since one of the goals of incubation was to
increase contributor diversity.

But with the big tent model, where there are significantly more
projects in OpenStack, and we don't pick 'winners' I don't think its
realistic to assume joining OpenStack guarantees a growth in contributor
diversity.

At the same time one of OpenStack's big attractions is community driven
projects where no single company overwhelmingly dominates.

Instead of the previous diversity requirement (Project must have a large and
diverse team of contributors) and a lower bar to at least make sure new
projects aren't overwhelmingly dominated by a single company.

Note: this raises the bar for projects to join OpenStack, but hopefully
in a way that aligns with the big tent initiative.

Change-Id: I98bbfc590677e4e1a89e4dc0d0c81f7fbd183026

commit_message:
Network verification status added into CSV

Status of 'verify_networks' action added into clusters CSV report.
DB model ActionLog added.
Column name in CSV report is 'verify_networks_status'.
Installation info filtering by dates fixed. We have datetime in the
InstallationStructure creation_date and modification_date. This causes
wrong filtration by dates results.

Change-Id: Ie758efc6b15d2ab737b16ac724eceb8efaff1aa6
Implements: blueprint export-stats-to-csv
Closes-Bug: #1415520

Ensure container_networks is an empty dict rather than None. This
ensures that if there are no container_networks on a host the
dynamic_inventory won't crash. container_networks is a required host
variable, setting it to an empty dict allows it to be ignored when

Closes-Bug: #1430430
"}]
commit_message:
Set container_networks to a dict rather than None

Ensure container_networks is an empty dict rather than None. This
ensures that if there are no container_networks on a host the
dynamic_inventory won't crash. container_networks is a required host
variable, setting it to an empty dict allows it to be ignored when
looping through if there are no container_networks.

Change-Id: Id0517ac6e06e704cf71964c03f016989db51fde5
Closes-Bug: #1430430

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-08-25 17:30:10.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift-account/install.d/swift-source-install/77-swift-account', 'elements/swift-storage/install.d/swift-source-install/76-swift-storage', 'elements/swift-account/install.d/swift-package-install/77-swift-account', 'elements/swift-account/os-apply-config/etc/swift/account-server.conf', 'elements/swift-object/os-apply-config/etc/swift/object-server.conf', 'elements/swift-storage/install.d/swift-package-install/76-swift-storage', 'elements/swift-object/install.d/swift-source-install/79-swift-object', 'elements/swift-container/install.d/swift-source-install/78-swift-container', 'elements/swift-account/element-deps', 'elements/swift-container/element-deps', 'elements/swift-object/README.md', 'elements/swift-container/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/76-swift-container', 'elements/swift-account/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/75-swift-account', 'elements/swift-container/README.md', 'elements/swift-object/install.d/swift-package-install/79-swift-object', 'elements/swift-container/install.d/swift-package-install/78-swift-container', 'elements/swift-storage/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/74-swift-storage', 'elements/swift-object/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/77-swift-object', 'elements/swift-account/README.md', 'elements/swift-object/element-deps', 'elements/swift-storage/element-deps', 'elements/swift-container/os-apply-config/etc/swift/container-server.conf'], 'message': 'Split swift-storage element into separate swift service elements

At the moment all swift storage services (acc/cont/obj) are located in the
same element and as a result, any nodes that are used for swift storage
will have all services running on them. However, it would be of benefit to
have the option to split these service accross different nodes. For example,
depending on what type of hardware is being utilised it can often be more
efficient splitting the object services from the account and container services.

This change splits the swift-storage element into four separate elements:

    - swift-storage
    - swift-account
    - swift-container
    - swift-object

Swift storage is now a less loaded element with common storage services and
tools such as rsync and recon. Each other element contains their own separate
packages, configuration files and process start-ups. The three extra elements
also have an element-dependancy on the swift-storage.

Note that I have added the three extra elements in the element-dependancy file
of swift-storage so that the devtest scripts do not break as a result of this
change. If this change is accepted, I will edit devtest_overcloud.py in the
tripleo-incubator environment to include the three extra elements and then
remove the extra elements dependancy introduced here.

Change-Id: I4f1f81f6efb91afa19ead4e3b58d0faea3a015a1
'}]
commit_message:
Split swift-storage element into separate swift service elements

At the moment all swift storage services (acc/cont/obj) are located in the
same element and as a result, any nodes that are used for swift storage
will have all services running on them. However, it would be of benefit to
have the option to split these service accross different nodes. For example,
depending on what type of hardware is being utilised it can often be more
efficient splitting the object services from the account and container services.

This change splits the swift-storage element into four separate elements:

    - swift-storage
    - swift-account
    - swift-container
    - swift-object

Swift storage is now a less loaded element with common storage services and
tools such as rsync and recon. Each other element contains their own separate
packages, configuration files and process start-ups. The three extra elements
also have an element-dependancy on the swift-storage.

Note that I have added the three extra elements in the element-dependancy file
of swift-storage so that the devtest scripts do not break as a result of this
change. If this change is accepted, I will edit devtest_overcloud.py in the
tripleo-incubator environment to include the three extra elements and then
remove the extra elements dependancy introduced here.

Change-Id: I4f1f81f6efb91afa19ead4e3b58d0faea3a015a1

order traits returned within events

- we order the traits by key in all the backends except sql. this
keeps sql inline.
- this reverts a patch to sort traits post query in test.

Change-Id: I17009bdb01106dc07659a9198da2090ec63bcf51
Closes-Bug: #1423714

commit_message:
Add separate XML and JSON response samples for port binding ext

Removed all port binding extension attributes from the list of
normal neutron port attributes. Updated the port api samples to
remove these attributes as well. Added a new set of samples specifically
for the port binding extended attributes section which do include the
binding-related attributes.

Change-Id: Ibebd1a2420ffeba4928eaae85166f366e05fc931
Closes-bug: #1373420

commit_message:
Call central's update_status correctly

* Cleaned up the way pool manager calls central's
update_status for create, delete and update.
* Cleaned up pool manager's update_status
* Added some more information to logging statements
when central's update_status and pool manager's
update_status are called
* When a domain is deleted, I see SERVFAIL too being
returned by BIND.  Added that to the list of error codes
to check
* memcache does not seem to store a value of None.
Worked around that bug.
* Updated unit tests
Closes-Bug: 1427433
Closes-Bug: 1427425
Change-Id: Id33381a967afd724ed56ac1d8df648b05a55516c

subject: Return 400 from object server if policy does not exist
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-10 05:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': 'Return 400 from object server if policy does not exist

Adds a check early in ssync_receiver request handler methods
that verify the policy_index specified in the request headers
actually maps to a policy. If not, return HTTPBadRequest.

* add test for object-server policy validation

Change-Id: I247f5ede67368538dcd7b1c39cd560bfa4b51c64
'}]
commit_message:
Return 400 from object server if policy does not exist

Adds a check early in ssync_receiver request handler methods
that verify the policy_index specified in the request headers
actually maps to a policy. If not, return HTTPBadRequest.

* add test for object-server policy validation

Change-Id: I247f5ede67368538dcd7b1c39cd560bfa4b51c64

subject: Add commands to operate snapshot config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 11:15:38.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/fuelclient/objects/task.py', 'fuelclient/fuelclient/tests/test_snapshot.py', 'fuelclient/fuelclient/cli/actions/release.py', 'fuelclient/fuelclient/cli/actions/snapshot.py', 'fuelclient/fuelclient/objects/node.py', 'fuelclient/fuelclient/cli/serializers.py', 'fuelclient/fuelclient/objects/environment.py'], 'message': 'Add commands to operate snapshot config

Added two commands to dump snapshot config
and provide it for snapshot task

Will download default config and dump it to stdout

fuel snapshot --conf > conf.yaml

Next command will accept config as input and bypass it to snapshot
generation request

fuel snapshot < conf.yaml

This is required to overwrite certain parameters if needed,
some of those are:
- target directory of snapshot generation
- timeout of snapshot generation procedure
- exclusion/inclusion of certain directories

Related-Bug: 1382511
Related-Bug: 1420054

Change-Id: I1ddab26fba1346dad30955289e7d28f4d3aa1562
'}]
commit_message:
Add commands to operate snapshot config

Added two commands to dump snapshot config
and provide it for snapshot task

Will download default config and dump it to stdout

fuel snapshot --conf > conf.yaml

Next command will accept config as input and bypass it to snapshot
generation request

fuel snapshot < conf.yaml

This is required to overwrite certain parameters if needed,
some of those are:
- target directory of snapshot generation
- timeout of snapshot generation procedure
- exclusion/inclusion of certain directories

Related-Bug: 1382511
Related-Bug: 1420054

Change-Id: I1ddab26fba1346dad30955289e7d28f4d3aa1562

commit_message:
Expose default snapshot config and allow to pass to snapshot request

Config will be exposed and dumped into file by fuel client.
After this is done, it will be directly consumed by shotgun
or some storage right in nailgun will be implemented to use
user defined config

Original-change: I5e01a7459cefe49a128192d82dd827f02866f909
Cant assign same one, because it was reverted one time

commit_message:
Wrap all lists in JSON object

Affected resources:
    alarm-definition-list   List alarm definitions for this tenant.
    alarm-history         Alarm state transition history.
    alarm-history-list   List alarms state history.
    alarm-list                List alarms for this tenant.
    measurement-list   List measurements for the specified metric.
    metric-list               List metrics for this tenant.
    metric-statistics     List measurement statistics for the specified metric.
    notification-list        List notifications for this tenant.

Change-Id: I9edc42c88c7e16a4fee8310d7dcfcf367bf2bfff

subject: Add public attr for shares
revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2015-03-12 12:28:33.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/api/v1/test_shares.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/base.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/services/share/json/shares_client.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'manila/api/v1/shares.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/test_shares_actions.py', 'manila/db/api.py', 'manila/tests/api/v1/test_share_metadata.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/db/migrations/alembic/versions/30cb96d995fa_add_is_public_column_for_share.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'manila/tests/api/contrib/stubs.py', 'manila/tests/policy.json', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/test_shares_negative.py', 'manila/api/views/shares.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/test_shares.py'], 'message': 'Add public attr for shares

For the moment only owner of share can see it. There are use cases when
we may want to share it for all, for example, only with "ro" access.

Shares should be able to be visible for all tenants - additional attr
'is_public=True/False' will work for it.

Add 'is_public' column to share model and add migration which creates
this new column (default is public=False).

Allow to pass new 'public' param to share api methods 'create' and
'get_all'.

Change DB API functions 'share_get_all_by_project' and '_share_get_all_with_filters'
to add public shares from all projects when 'public=True' is provided.

Implements bp level-of-visibility-for-shares

Change-Id: I444f5b3aceea8322d947722e945ff81c0b2b84cc
'}]
commit_message:
Add public attr for shares

For the moment only owner of share can see it. There are use cases when
we may want to share it for all, for example, only with "ro" access.

Shares should be able to be visible for all tenants - additional attr
'is_public=True/False' will work for it.

Add 'is_public' column to share model and add migration which creates
this new column (default is public=False).

Allow to pass new 'public' param to share api methods 'create' and
'get_all'.

Change DB API functions 'share_get_all_by_project' and '_share_get_all_with_filters'
to add public shares from all projects when 'public=True' is provided.

Implements bp level-of-visibility-for-shares

Change-Id: I444f5b3aceea8322d947722e945ff81c0b2b84cc

subject: Set rootfstype=ramfs for low memory Ironic nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-11 21:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Set rootfstype=ramfs for low memory Ironic nodes

When running with low memory (<1024), we need to switch from the default
rootfstype from tmpfs to ramfs to ensure nodes can decompress deployment
ramdisks.

Backport of commit 756c842a7743a84a084b4cc211998e3fdd171592.

Change-Id: I1b9dd614e592d99b2f59dea899b1ed3859ae0811
'}]
commit_message:
Set rootfstype=ramfs for low memory Ironic nodes

When running with low memory (<1024), we need to switch from the default
rootfstype from tmpfs to ramfs to ensure nodes can decompress deployment
ramdisks.

Backport of commit 756c842a7743a84a084b4cc211998e3fdd171592.

Change-Id: I1b9dd614e592d99b2f59dea899b1ed3859ae0811

subject: Remove my_ip from cinder.conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 2861, 'name': 'Vincent Hou', 'email': 'shou@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'houshengbo'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7715, 'name': 'Hirofumi Ichihara', 'email': 'ichihara.hirofumi@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hirofumi-Ichihara'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-12 02:18:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Remove my_ip from cinder.conf

The current issue is that if we deploy c-vol service on a separate
machine, my_ip and SERVICE_HOST will be different, because my_ip is
the machine where c-vol service is running and SERVICE_HOST points
to the machine where the cinder api service is running. If my_ip of
c-vol in cinder.conf is set to the IP of c-api, it will cause the
issue that the volume is unable to attach. The issue can be resolved
by removing my_ip from cinder.conf.

Change-Id: I699c0b5297c60e9f9934f74684abf563f4b0e977
closes-bug: #1428013
'}]
commit_message:
Remove my_ip from cinder.conf

The current issue is that if we deploy c-vol service on a separate
machine, my_ip and SERVICE_HOST will be different, because my_ip is
the machine where c-vol service is running and SERVICE_HOST points
to the machine where the cinder api service is running. If my_ip of
c-vol in cinder.conf is set to the IP of c-api, it will cause the
issue that the volume is unable to attach. The issue can be resolved
by removing my_ip from cinder.conf.

Change-Id: I699c0b5297c60e9f9934f74684abf563f4b0e977
closes-bug: #1428013

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-11 16:53:11.000000000', 'files': ['lib/sahara'], 'message': 'Add data-processing service for Sahara

When registering endpoint with data_processing Keystone transforms it
into data-processing. This problem causes sahara to not find the
endpoint afterwards

We need to have two endpoint for correct working tempest and horizon
with devstack. After resolving bug in tempest and horizon need to remove
old data_processing endpoint

Change-Id: I97827d23ffe8a1218abd61e76804b918b1b7cbe0
Partial-bug: #1356053
(cherry picked from commit 77f82f38496f364b7cc6d2a5bc8b45432934a130)
'}]
commit_message:
Add data-processing service for Sahara

When registering endpoint with data_processing Keystone transforms it
into data-processing. This problem causes sahara to not find the
endpoint afterwards

We need to have two endpoint for correct working tempest and horizon
with devstack. After resolving bug in tempest and horizon need to remove
old data_processing endpoint

Change-Id: I97827d23ffe8a1218abd61e76804b918b1b7cbe0
Partial-bug: #1356053
(cherry picked from commit 77f82f38496f364b7cc6d2a5bc8b45432934a130)

commit_message:
Remove page_size from compute GET servers

The compute v2 GET API "List servers" doc reference a 'page_size'
pagination param that is never used in the nova GET servers code;
only limit and marker are supported.

Change-Id: I9b434fd46e38a9e5a273dd4ccb38f2a22a1d071d
Closes-Bug: 1428280

commit_message:
Switch fuel-agent to single `parted` call

Firing multiple `parted` calls within short period of time produces
'device or resource is busy' error. Switching to single call should
significally reduce the probability of that error appearing.

Change-Id: I95608ef6718e2b6ce4513f030730eb85aba85f16

subject: IBP: Added sleep 10 after node reboot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 16:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/orchestrator.rb'], 'message': 'IBP: Added sleep 10 after node reboot

The reason for this fix to appear is that Cobbler runs reboot
command and reports reboot succeeded, but astute manages to get the type
of node OS via Mcollective (/etc/nailgun_systemtype) and runs node erasing
procedure for the nodes which type!=target. Erasing procedure in turn
kicks sysrq trigger which breaks the node.

Change-Id: I98cc29256fb9a807aba9b6dddc500864c74bd735
Closes-Bug: 1420256
'}]
commit_message:
IBP: Added sleep 10 after node reboot

The reason for this fix to appear is that Cobbler runs reboot
command and reports reboot succeeded, but astute manages to get the type
of node OS via Mcollective (/etc/nailgun_systemtype) and runs node erasing
procedure for the nodes which type!=target. Erasing procedure in turn
kicks sysrq trigger which breaks the node.

Change-Id: I98cc29256fb9a807aba9b6dddc500864c74bd735
Closes-Bug: 1420256

commit_message:
Remove reference to Jenkins in PTI

Mentioning Jenkins is over-specification in this document.  It is
our current tool, but may not always be.  Refer to the CI system
instead.

Change-Id: I4cdf0c08a1a9e456243a687f453917570495c9a6

commit_message:
Update the Infrastructure project homepage URL

The wiki article at the old Infrastructure project homepage URL
contained only information which is now redundant with what is in
the reference/projects.yaml file and governance.openstack.org site
content, along with a link to what is now the new URL.

commit_message:
Revert "Trim ansible's output to console.log"

This reverts commit a9244537d62662ab3342d1c1bdb74e3b1f23ad0e.

Revert is required because this patch removes all output from the
console log, rather than reducing the verbosity as intended.

Change-Id: I33700ca75ea16e6eb93f2e43d814d70960145ff4

commit_message:
Add AMT-PXE-Driver Power&Management&Vendor Interface

Introduce a new driver pxe-amt to extend Ironic's range to desktops.
AMT (Active Management Technology)/vPro is widely used in desktops
to remotely control the power, similar to IPMI in servers.
It will use AMT as power management and PXE as deploy management.
This patch only provides basic operations to support the workflow of
remotely deploying on AMT/vPro system.

This adds power, management and it's own vendor interface.
This also adds a new fake-amt driver.

Implements blueprint amt-pxe-driver
Change-Id: Idd9b63d124f52e24efab8b49dfe1f2e25b8387e6

subject: Fix kwargs['instance'] KeyError in @reverts_task_state decorator
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 21:48:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix kwargs['instance'] KeyError in @reverts_task_state decorator

We use @reverts_task_state everywhere in the compute manager and we
ensure that 'instance' is a parameter to the decorator method via
@utils.expects_func_args('instance'), however, that only ensures there
is an instance argument, not that it's in args or kwargs (either is fine
for what expects_func_args checks).

The reverts_task_state decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['instance'] and fail to revert the task_state on the instance,
which can leave us in a bad state where non-admins can't delete the
instance if the task_state is not None (and the reset-state API is
admin-only).

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the instance from.

Also adds a warning log if we fail the instance update since it
shouldn't happen and we want to know if it does because of the
aforementioned problems with deleting orphaned instances.

There isn't a specific unit test added for this since moving
kwargs['instance'] above the try/except in reverts_task_state makes a
lot of tests fail already if you don't have the normalize code.

Closes-Bug: #1423952

Change-Id: I70f464120c798422f9a3d601b7cdf3b0a8320690
(cherry picked from commit c43f2b0d708f0f4b37850d2917c0abcc13b8789b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kwargs['instance'] KeyError in @reverts_task_state decorator

We use @reverts_task_state everywhere in the compute manager and we
ensure that 'instance' is a parameter to the decorator method via
@utils.expects_func_args('instance'), however, that only ensures there
is an instance argument, not that it's in args or kwargs (either is fine
for what expects_func_args checks).

The reverts_task_state decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['instance'] and fail to revert the task_state on the instance,
which can leave us in a bad state where non-admins can't delete the
instance if the task_state is not None (and the reset-state API is
admin-only).

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the instance from.

Also adds a warning log if we fail the instance update since it
shouldn't happen and we want to know if it does because of the
aforementioned problems with deleting orphaned instances.

There isn't a specific unit test added for this since moving
kwargs['instance'] above the try/except in reverts_task_state makes a
lot of tests fail already if you don't have the normalize code.

Closes-Bug: #1423952

Change-Id: I70f464120c798422f9a3d601b7cdf3b0a8320690
(cherry picked from commit c43f2b0d708f0f4b37850d2917c0abcc13b8789b)

commit_message:
Enable Neutron in neutronclient functional test job

nova-network is used in python-neutronclient functional test job now.
No endpoint is configured for Nuetron, and neutronclient funcational
test will fail completely.

Change-Id: I00e56cab162941bb9d9bd84d0fffd66e9698bb4c
Related-Bug: #1429289

subject: Wait for keystone to be fully initialized
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-07 00:24:26.000000000', 'files': ['docker/glance/glance-api/wait_for', 'docker/glance/glance-api/Dockerfile', 'docker/glance/glance-api/start.sh'], 'message': "Wait for keystone to be fully initialized

Previously we used check_for_keystone() which just checked that the
keystone v2.0 public endpoint was responding to a http GET. Instead we
now check that making an admin-level request via the keystone client
works correctly. This ensures that the admin tenant and admin role all
exist before proceeding with the rest of the script. Doing so
guarantees that we don't run into a race condition that can occur if
you are starting up multiple containers simultaneously. The problem
can arise if you make two concurrent calls to crux user-create that
both potentially try to create the admin role and tenant. For example
the call in this script and another in keystone/start.sh. See Bug
1429104 for more details.

We could immediately bail out of this script if the new keystone check
fails and stop the container from starting. However I preferred not to
do this and use the wait_for script because it seemed a little more
elegant and also I thought it could result in a faster start up time
e.g. waiting 1sec to check keystone again maybe faster than tearing
down the container and starting it back up again and may generate
less churn in the container logs.

wait_for is a script I gratuitously stole from
openstack/tripleo-incubator/tree/master/scripts. The tripleo team don't
believe in doing releases from that repo, so other than a git checkout
of master there really isn't a nice cross distro way to consume it. If
we think the script could be useful elsewhere then maybe it could
eventually be moved into ./base container

Change-Id: Ic27a9c5d050f0cb9103acf5d5e28840a313c3239
Closes-Bug: 1429104
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for keystone to be fully initialized

Previously we used check_for_keystone() which just checked that the
keystone v2.0 public endpoint was responding to a http GET. Instead we
now check that making an admin-level request via the keystone client
works correctly. This ensures that the admin tenant and admin role all
exist before proceeding with the rest of the script. Doing so
guarantees that we don't run into a race condition that can occur if
you are starting up multiple containers simultaneously. The problem
can arise if you make two concurrent calls to crux user-create that
both potentially try to create the admin role and tenant. For example
the call in this script and another in keystone/start.sh. See Bug
1429104 for more details.

We could immediately bail out of this script if the new keystone check
fails and stop the container from starting. However I preferred not to
do this and use the wait_for script because it seemed a little more
elegant and also I thought it could result in a faster start up time
e.g. waiting 1sec to check keystone again maybe faster than tearing
down the container and starting it back up again and may generate
less churn in the container logs.

wait_for is a script I gratuitously stole from
openstack/tripleo-incubator/tree/master/scripts. The tripleo team don't
believe in doing releases from that repo, so other than a git checkout
of master there really isn't a nice cross distro way to consume it. If
we think the script could be useful elsewhere then maybe it could
eventually be moved into ./base container

Change-Id: Ic27a9c5d050f0cb9103acf5d5e28840a313c3239
Closes-Bug: 1429104

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-23 11:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/capabilties.rst'], 'message': "Allow capabilities for scheduling from Nova

This spec talks about how capabilities may be
used from Nova for scheduling and how an operator
can configure nodes with capabilities.

NOTE: This spec is more of an agreement on how to
use capabilities for scheduling after the recent
patch merged in Nova (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141012/).
This spec doesn't propose anything new.  The
actual work for a generic way for mentioning hardware

Change-Id: I256d286e93fa2256b94af6d884f884cba4a51379
"}]
commit_message:
Allow capabilities for scheduling from Nova

This spec talks about how capabilities may be
used from Nova for scheduling and how an operator
can configure nodes with capabilities.

NOTE: This spec is more of an agreement on how to
use capabilities for scheduling after the recent
patch merged in Nova (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141012/).
This spec doesn't propose anything new.  The
actual work for a generic way for mentioning hardware
capabilities/driver capabilities has been bumped to L
and will be looked on in the next release.

Change-Id: I256d286e93fa2256b94af6d884f884cba4a51379

commit_message:
Fixes element-info -d ubuntu errors

This patch adds the default elements path in the $ELEMENTS_PATH
environment variable. It also appends the default $ELEMENTS_PATH
if user had exported the $ELEMENTS_PATH in the enviroment.

Change-Id: Ic9da7c2d87aa13c6cf110a94ca521c8f6a1b0208
Closes-bug: #1265650
