revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-03-11 08:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/manager.py', 'cinder/service.py', 'cinder/scheduler/manager.py'], 'message': "Allow scheduler to receive volume stats when starting service

Filter scheduler relies on volume services to report their stats in
order to make decisions - this nature makes scheduler service a bit
special when it starts because it can't really do anything without
knowning stats of avilable volume backend.  So the original
implementation of Filter Scheduler added a hook in init_host() to
ask all volume services to send their stats immediately (volume RPC
call 'publish_service_capabitlies()'), this reduced the chance of a
new volume being set to 'error' state because scheduler has no
knowledge of backends to minimum.

             Scheduler       RPC Exchanges    Volume Service(s)
service start | RPC init                          |
              | init_host()                       |
              | --pub_src_caps()-->|  ----------> | (vol fanout)
              |     <-------------  |<-vol stats--| (sch fanout)

However, commit 65fa80c361f71158cc492dfc520dc4a63ccfa419 moved
init_host() ahead of service RPC initialization because for volume
services, service initialization should be done before the service
starts accepting RPC requests.  This change unfortunately invalidated
scheduler service's init_host() because that needs to be done *AFTER*
RPC is ready (a queue is bound to scheduler fanout exchange).  The
result is scheduler asks vol service to send update, but it misses
the information it asked for because its queue hasn't been created
and bound to the fanout queue yet.  So scheduler always has to wait
for the next update from volume services to be able to work properly.

             Scheduler       RPC Exchanges    Volume Service(s)
service start | init_host()                       |
              | --pub_src_caps()-->|  ----------> | (vol fanout)
              |   (vol stats lost)  |<-vol stats--| (sch fanout)
              | RPC init                          |

This change adds a new hook to Manager class called init_hook_with_rpc()
to allow services like scheduler to do something once RPC is ready.
This should restore scheduler's behavior before commit
65fa80c361f71158cc492dfc520dc4a63ccfa419.

Change-Id: If6cf9030eb44c39a06ec501ac5c049d460782481
Partial-bug: #1409012
"}]
commit_message:
Allow scheduler to receive volume stats when starting service

Filter scheduler relies on volume services to report their stats in
order to make decisions - this nature makes scheduler service a bit
special when it starts because it can't really do anything without
knowning stats of avilable volume backend.  So the original
implementation of Filter Scheduler added a hook in init_host() to
ask all volume services to send their stats immediately (volume RPC
call 'publish_service_capabitlies()'), this reduced the chance of a
new volume being set to 'error' state because scheduler has no
knowledge of backends to minimum.

             Scheduler       RPC Exchanges    Volume Service(s)
service start | RPC init                          |
              | init_host()                       |
              | --pub_src_caps()-->|  ----------> | (vol fanout)
              |     <-------------  |<-vol stats--| (sch fanout)

However, commit 65fa80c361f71158cc492dfc520dc4a63ccfa419 moved
init_host() ahead of service RPC initialization because for volume
services, service initialization should be done before the service
starts accepting RPC requests.  This change unfortunately invalidated
scheduler service's init_host() because that needs to be done *AFTER*
RPC is ready (a queue is bound to scheduler fanout exchange).  The
result is scheduler asks vol service to send update, but it misses
the information it asked for because its queue hasn't been created
and bound to the fanout queue yet.  So scheduler always has to wait
for the next update from volume services to be able to work properly.

             Scheduler       RPC Exchanges    Volume Service(s)
service start | init_host()                       |
              | --pub_src_caps()-->|  ----------> | (vol fanout)
              |   (vol stats lost)  |<-vol stats--| (sch fanout)
              | RPC init                          |

This change adds a new hook to Manager class called init_hook_with_rpc()
to allow services like scheduler to do something once RPC is ready.
This should restore scheduler's behavior before commit
65fa80c361f71158cc492dfc520dc4a63ccfa419.

Change-Id: If6cf9030eb44c39a06ec501ac5c049d460782481
Partial-bug: #1409012

commit_message:
adopt namespace-less oslo imports

oslo.config is now deprecated, so switching from oslo.config to right
package oslo_config. similarly oslo.serialization also deprecated, it
is also switched to oslo_serialization from oslo.serialization.

Change-Id: I54d226d702782c83cd18e2ef25e899346c0867ae
Closes-bug: #1416516

commit_message:
Interface must go prior to its subinterfaces

Each interface should go prior to its subinterfaces in transformations section of network scheme.
So, appropriate ports ordering was added.
Also, add_port() function was fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1430738
Change-Id: I0c8d23b20e5e701cac0f620062fa09e3ff4c3186

subject: Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-12 11:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': 'Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information

This patch adjusts the method introduced in
I98fb57a56c1b7ddd6558e265cf6e65b159a05123 to trim the debug information
from the ansible output.

This adjustment allows the output to come to the console immediately,
instead of piping to a file and doing the processing after the ansible
run is complete.

Change-Id: I515adcad34ef76b8ea47fe90bc6572fb3aec1d2c
Partial-bug: #1425482
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information

This patch adjusts the method introduced in
I98fb57a56c1b7ddd6558e265cf6e65b159a05123 to trim the debug information
from the ansible output.

This adjustment allows the output to come to the console immediately,
instead of piping to a file and doing the processing after the ansible
run is complete.

Change-Id: I515adcad34ef76b8ea47fe90bc6572fb3aec1d2c
Partial-bug: #1425482

subject: Removed ubuntu target images from ISO
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-11 14:15:51.000000000', 'files': ['image/module.mk', 'iso/module.mk'], 'message': 'Removed ubuntu target images from ISO

We are not allowed to re-distribute
ubuntu packages as well as ubuntu images.
We are going to build ubuntu target images
just before we start actual provision process.

This patch removes ubuntu target images from ISO.

Change-Id: Ic1b320bd4becd9deef0aaf326f8f05957958ca1c
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
'}]
commit_message:
Removed ubuntu target images from ISO

We are not allowed to re-distribute
ubuntu packages as well as ubuntu images.
We are going to build ubuntu target images
just before we start actual provision process.

This patch removes ubuntu target images from ISO.

Change-Id: Ic1b320bd4becd9deef0aaf326f8f05957958ca1c
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

commit_message:
Adding barbican client and keymgr module

This change implements the key manager abstraction module and barbican
client helper for the improved secret storage spec.

Changes
* adding barbican module
* adding keymgr module
* adding a session method to the keystone module
* adding tests for keymgr module
* adding documentation for keymgr usage

SecurityImpact

Implements: blueprint improved-secret-storage
Change-Id: I462f2f6cdc35470f75771b5beca10899a591b46a

commit_message:
Add config option to override url for versions

The versions url returns the wrong data when cinder api is behind
a proxy. This adds a new config option so it can be set properly.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I46a90120b21e43bf8dca9e5f0efdf339f0d3e8e6
Closes-Bug: #1384379

commit_message:
Define the behavior for a 405 response

This commit adds language to the API reference describing the behavior
of the service when a request is sent to a recognized API URI, but the
request does not use a supported HTTP method.

Change-Id: I31143ea0f7e6727b7f80f83dced10c68c44ffe1a

subject: rest: uses search query to filter on metric aggregation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 12:32:31.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'doc/source/rest.j2', 'doc/source/rest.yaml', 'gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py'], 'message': 'rest: uses search query to filter on metric aggregation

This patches change the metric aggregation for resources so it uses a
dedicated endpoint that accepts the same kind of filtering than the
search queries. That allows for much powerful filtering on resources.

commit_message:
rest: uses search query to filter on metric aggregation

This patches change the metric aggregation for resources so it uses a
dedicated endpoint that accepts the same kind of filtering than the
search queries. That allows for much powerful filtering on resources.

Change-Id: I05ab0b7dd5548ae39d061c46768618ea1455d1e0

subject: Fix Incorrect parameters for Neutron Port APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-11 19:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/netconn-api/src/os-ports.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/netconn-api/src/os-ports-binding-ext.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/netconn-api/src/common.ent'], 'message': 'Fix Incorrect parameters for Neutron Port APIs

1. Query parameters
   Add Query parameters for List API.
2. Read-only parameters for Binding Extension
   Remove vif_detail and vif_type from Request parameter for Add/Update APIs.
3. Details for xsd:dict parameter
   Add sub parameters of xsd:dict parameters such as allowed_address_pairs and extra_dhcp_opts.
4. device_id and device_owner
   Add device_id and device_owner for Create/Update APIs

Change-Id: I8baffc669d1e16260ae156d2718029cfb3513fb8
Closes-Bug: #1425783
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Incorrect parameters for Neutron Port APIs

1. Query parameters
   Add Query parameters for List API.
2. Read-only parameters for Binding Extension
   Remove vif_detail and vif_type from Request parameter for Add/Update APIs.
3. Details for xsd:dict parameter
   Add sub parameters of xsd:dict parameters such as allowed_address_pairs and extra_dhcp_opts.
4. device_id and device_owner
   Add device_id and device_owner for Create/Update APIs

Change-Id: I8baffc669d1e16260ae156d2718029cfb3513fb8
Closes-Bug: #1425783

The limit/marker API documentation is very inconsistent across projects and
this patch set standardizes it by:

* Creating a common_project.ent file that contains entities to be shared
  across multiple projects
* Adding the limit/marker param entities to the common file
* Updating the existing references to limit/marker to use the common file

This patch set also adds the missing limit/marker params to the appropriate
cinder docs.

Change-Id: Ic95d2d88cb5caa804fb45fc62b61665a97e4dde9
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize REST API pagination params

The limit/marker API documentation is very inconsistent across projects and
this patch set standardizes it by:

* Creating a common_project.ent file that contains entities to be shared
  across multiple projects
* Adding the limit/marker param entities to the common file
* Updating the existing references to limit/marker to use the common file

This patch set also adds the missing limit/marker params to the appropriate
cinder docs.

Change-Id: Ic95d2d88cb5caa804fb45fc62b61665a97e4dde9

subject: IBP: Added sleep 10 after node reboot
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 15:08:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/orchestrator.rb'], 'message': 'IBP: Added sleep 10 after node reboot

The reason for this fix to appear is that Cobbler runs reboot
command and reports reboot succeeded, but astute manages to get the type
of node OS via Mcollective (/etc/nailgun_systemtype) and runs node erasing
procedure for the nodes which type!=target. Erasing procedure in turn
kicks sysrq trigger which breaks the node.

Change-Id: I98cc29256fb9a807aba9b6dddc500864c74bd735
Closes-Bug: 1420256
'}]
commit_message:
IBP: Added sleep 10 after node reboot

The reason for this fix to appear is that Cobbler runs reboot
command and reports reboot succeeded, but astute manages to get the type
of node OS via Mcollective (/etc/nailgun_systemtype) and runs node erasing
procedure for the nodes which type!=target. Erasing procedure in turn
kicks sysrq trigger which breaks the node.

Change-Id: I98cc29256fb9a807aba9b6dddc500864c74bd735
Closes-Bug: 1420256

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-12 03:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': "Add Digest intrinsic function

Digest intrinsic function takes an algorithm name (e.g. md5, sha512,
etc) and a string value and will resolve to the corresponding hash of
the value.

Usage:

    pwd_hash: { digest: ['sha512', { get_param: raw_password }] }

Implements: blueprint digest-intrinsic-function
Change-Id: I7b5332462013cf8063fadec1654fa9f364da45de
"}]
commit_message:
Add Digest intrinsic function

Digest intrinsic function takes an algorithm name (e.g. md5, sha512,
etc) and a string value and will resolve to the corresponding hash of
the value.

Usage:

    pwd_hash: { digest: ['sha512', { get_param: raw_password }] }

Implements: blueprint digest-intrinsic-function
Change-Id: I7b5332462013cf8063fadec1654fa9f364da45de

commit_message:
qpid: Always auto-delete queue of DirectConsumer

In case of the call()er die, the queue used to reply must be
automatically deleted, otherwise they will never been deleted.

This is done in the same way as the rabbit drivers does,
by enabling auto-delete on this queue.

Change-Id: Ib01981d704b8849e0115791ff90fbb74cbac421f
Closes-Bug: #1374519

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 11:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/db/db_util.py', 'midonet/neutron/db/task.py'], 'message': "Infer router instead of requiring it

* This change allows using our LB functionality through Horizon.
* It still requires that a router ID be given, however instead of
  requiring it from the user, it can be inferred from the subnet id by
  going through the neutron database.
* The limitations are:
  1) The subnet used by the Pool must be associated with a router.
  2) If an external subnet is used for the VIP, then the router
  associated with the pool's subnet must have its gateway set.

Fixes: MNP-25

This commit is backported from previous project
`python-neutron-plugin-midonet`:
https://github.com/midonet/python-neutron-plugin-midonet/commit/\

Change-Id: I80837416b9944b2adb2e6b1b500f73d065a906c5
"}]
commit_message:
Infer router instead of requiring it

* This change allows using our LB functionality through Horizon.
* It still requires that a router ID be given, however instead of
  requiring it from the user, it can be inferred from the subnet id by
  going through the neutron database.
* The limitations are:
  1) The subnet used by the Pool must be associated with a router.
  2) If an external subnet is used for the VIP, then the router
  associated with the pool's subnet must have its gateway set.

Fixes: MNP-25

This commit is backported from previous project
`python-neutron-plugin-midonet`:
https://github.com/midonet/python-neutron-plugin-midonet/commit/\
94e8378e423e4355ce35b782c15393889a909c87

Change-Id: I80837416b9944b2adb2e6b1b500f73d065a906c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 20:41:08.000000000', 'files': ['iso/ks.template'], 'message': 'Removed debian-installer initrd and kernel

We are not allowed to re-distribute ubuntu debian-installer
kernel and initrd. So, we are going to download these files
from one of user defined ubuntu repos. We implemented this
as a pre-provision task which is supposed to run a shell
script.

This patch removes original ubuntu debian-installer
ramdisk and kernel and substitutes them with zero files just
to make sure cobbler is able to create corresponding Distro.

Change-Id: Ie154cfdf3c6e9b4f063ab859cd050be6faa1707e
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
'}]
commit_message:
Removed debian-installer initrd and kernel

We are not allowed to re-distribute ubuntu debian-installer
kernel and initrd. So, we are going to download these files
from one of user defined ubuntu repos. We implemented this
as a pre-provision task which is supposed to run a shell
script.

This patch removes original ubuntu debian-installer
ramdisk and kernel and substitutes them with zero files just
to make sure cobbler is able to create corresponding Distro.

Change-Id: Ie154cfdf3c6e9b4f063ab859cd050be6faa1707e
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

commit_message:
Allow full v3 authentication

Allow authenticating with ids and fetching domain scoped tokens. Changes the
acceptable parameters to more specific parameter names so that _id and _name
parameters can no longer be confused.

This tries to not change the config file and existing credential loading paths.

Closes-Bug: #1420605
Change-Id: If5a889be5826d60bf61dbb84661a5896cb094875

commit_message:
Func test conf to specify boot config

This adds a functional test config option boot_config_env which
can specify a path to an environment file which defines boot config
resources for any test which needs the heat agent projects.

By default this value points to boot_config_none_env.yaml, which assumes
the image is already completely configured with the heat agent projects.

The aim is that in the gate jobs the following will be set:
boot_config_env=/opt/stack/new/heat-templates/hot/software-config/boot-config/test_image_env.yaml

And the image_ref will refer to the latest built image in
http://tarballs.openstack.org/heat-test-image/

Change-Id: I1fa09bf3a8be248829061b931dd773973732fa52

commit_message:
Add lockutils.get_lock_path() function

Provide an API to discover the path being used to store external lock
files. Tempest will use this to set up some additional locking and to
test its own behavior. Other projects might use it for error reporting
or other purposes.

Change-Id: Iad40c67072333cc25a6d3e39d7535ff14b573504

Many (most) clouds won't have the assumed network to directly ping/ssh
to the default IP address. This changes test_server_cfn_init to assign
a floating IP, and use that to ping and ssh to the server.

It also moves the ping to the end of the test. This was initially

Change-Id: Ia9404289b2f9632883a479ccb435cbf6c51fcf2f
"}]
commit_message:
Use AWS::EC2::EIP for test_server_cfn_init

Many (most) clouds won't have the assumed network to directly ping/ssh
to the default IP address. This changes test_server_cfn_init to assign
a floating IP, and use that to ping and ssh to the server.

It also moves the ping to the end of the test. This was initially
meant to catch regressions in a co-gated neutron, but it is no longer
required for a heat-only test.

Change-Id: Ia9404289b2f9632883a479ccb435cbf6c51fcf2f

subject: Puppet: Configure neutron_api_class on controller
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-11 20:57:30.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/compute.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/common.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Puppet: Configure neutron_api_class on controller

We're already configuring Neutron in Overcloud, but the controller
is still configured to use the default Nova neutron_api_class for
default configuration for networking, which means it used Nova Network
and not Neutron. This causes some of the Nova API is_neutron
checks to behave incorrectly.

This patch updates the controller to use nova::network::neutron (like
we already do on the overcloud_compute.pp role). As part of the change
several of the compute specific hiera settings for the
nova::network::neutron class have been moved to common.yaml.

Change-Id: Id2d5a5a0aa1ca087de714880ef1ea98484b06849
"}]
commit_message:
Puppet: Configure neutron_api_class on controller

We're already configuring Neutron in Overcloud, but the controller
is still configured to use the default Nova neutron_api_class for
default configuration for networking, which means it used Nova Network
and not Neutron. This causes some of the Nova API is_neutron
checks to behave incorrectly.

This patch updates the controller to use nova::network::neutron (like
we already do on the overcloud_compute.pp role). As part of the change
several of the compute specific hiera settings for the
nova::network::neutron class have been moved to common.yaml.

Change-Id: Id2d5a5a0aa1ca087de714880ef1ea98484b06849

commit_message:
Update volume type name for volume type API

This continues the change for updating volume type to
include changing name.

- Updated the following APIs and tests for volume type

* update volume type
PUT http://<openstackhost>:8776/v2/${tenant_id}/types/${vol_type_id}
body
{
    "volume_type": {
      "name": "test_updated",
      "description":"updated_desc"
    }
}

** user can update name
** if update name, name can not be empty spaces.
** if update name, can not change the name to be the same as the one
in another volume type
** name and description can not be both None

Implements: blueprint volume-type-description
Change-Id: Idc08f796932df709ff20c17f6bc8d4753d85ad3c

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-02-14 18:08:52.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/profile.py', 'etc/trove/trove.conf.sample', 'etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample', 'requirements.txt', 'etc/trove/trove-conductor.conf.sample', 'trove/cmd/api.py', 'trove/rpc.py', 'etc/trove/api-paste.ini', 'trove/common/cfg.py', 'etc/trove/trove-taskmanager.conf.sample', 'trove/db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'trove/common/rpc/service.py'], 'message': 'Integrate OSprofiler and Trove

*) Add osprofiler wsgi middleware
This middleware is used for 2 things:
1) It checks that the person who wants to trace is trusted and knows
the secret HMAC key.
2) It start tracing in case of proper trace headers
and adds the first wsgi trace point, with info about the HTTP request.

*) Add initialization of osprofiler at start of service
Initialize osprofiler with oslo.messaging notifier which
is used to send notifications to Ceilometer.

*) Use profile enabled context in services rpc interaction
Change context serializer to pass profile context to service;
rpc server will use trace info to initialize their profile context
to continue the profiling for the request as a transaction.

*) Add tracing on service manager and sqlalchemy db engine object

NOTE to test this:
You should put to localrc:
  CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=notifications,profiler
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-acompute,ceilometer-acentral
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-anotification,ceilometer-collector
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,ceilometer-alarm-notifier
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-api

Run any command with --profile <SECRET_KEY>
  $ trove --profile <SECRET_KEY> list
  # it will print <Trace ID>
Get pretty HTML with traces:
  $ osprofiler trace show --html <Trace ID>
Note: Trace showing can be executed with the admin account only.

The change to enable Trove exchange in ceilometer has been merged:
Idce1c327c6d21a767c612c13c1ad52a794017d71 .

The change to enable profile in python-troveclient has been merged:
I5a76e11d428c63d33f6d2c2021426090ebf8340c

We prepared a common BP in oslo-spec as the integration change is
similar in all projects: I95dccdc9f274661767d2659c18b96da169891f30
Currently there are 2 other projects are using osprofiler: Glance &
Cinder, and some others are a work in progress.

Change-Id: I580cce8d2b3c4ec9ce625ac09de6f14e1249f6f5
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Integrate OSprofiler and Trove

*) Add osprofiler wsgi middleware
This middleware is used for 2 things:
1) It checks that the person who wants to trace is trusted and knows
the secret HMAC key.
2) It start tracing in case of proper trace headers
and adds the first wsgi trace point, with info about the HTTP request.

*) Add initialization of osprofiler at start of service
Initialize osprofiler with oslo.messaging notifier which
is used to send notifications to Ceilometer.

*) Use profile enabled context in services rpc interaction
Change context serializer to pass profile context to service;
rpc server will use trace info to initialize their profile context
to continue the profiling for the request as a transaction.

*) Add tracing on service manager and sqlalchemy db engine object

NOTE to test this:
You should put to localrc:
  CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=notifications,profiler
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-acompute,ceilometer-acentral
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-anotification,ceilometer-collector
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,ceilometer-alarm-notifier
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-api

Run any command with --profile <SECRET_KEY>
  $ trove --profile <SECRET_KEY> list
  # it will print <Trace ID>
Get pretty HTML with traces:
  $ osprofiler trace show --html <Trace ID>
Note: Trace showing can be executed with the admin account only.

The change to enable Trove exchange in ceilometer has been merged:
Idce1c327c6d21a767c612c13c1ad52a794017d71 .

The change to enable profile in python-troveclient has been merged:
I5a76e11d428c63d33f6d2c2021426090ebf8340c

We prepared a common BP in oslo-spec as the integration change is
similar in all projects: I95dccdc9f274661767d2659c18b96da169891f30
Currently there are 2 other projects are using osprofiler: Glance &
Cinder, and some others are a work in progress.

Change-Id: I580cce8d2b3c4ec9ce625ac09de6f14e1249f6f5
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

Allow to provide timeout for snapshot generation

even when snapshot can not be generated in given timeout

Closes-Bug: 1414059

subject: Set backend_alg for swift_proxy to source
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-10 11:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/vars/config_vars/haproxy_config.yml'], 'message': 'Set backend_alg for swift_proxy to source

This is a backport of 94ba3bc and 51abd0b from master to juno branch.
Commit 94ba3bc set HAProxy balance algorithm to "source" for swift-proxy
(required by Tempest which makes a lot of quick successive calls to
swift-proxy and were failing when using the default algorithm of
"leastconn").  Commit 51abd0b went back and cleaned up all the
incorrectly referenced variables (_backend_alg to _balance_alg) as the
change made in 94ba3bc wasn't actually taking effect.

Note that the ansible variable name in master is haproxy_balance_alg
whilst in juno it is hap_balance_alg.

Change-Id: I993e019c06f6d7ea7f77dc741d3d418e78ce2ca9
Closes-Bug: #1428081
Closes-Bug: #1429109
'}]
commit_message:
Set backend_alg for swift_proxy to source

This is a backport of 94ba3bc and 51abd0b from master to juno branch.
Commit 94ba3bc set HAProxy balance algorithm to "source" for swift-proxy
(required by Tempest which makes a lot of quick successive calls to
swift-proxy and were failing when using the default algorithm of
"leastconn").  Commit 51abd0b went back and cleaned up all the
incorrectly referenced variables (_backend_alg to _balance_alg) as the
change made in 94ba3bc wasn't actually taking effect.

Note that the ansible variable name in master is haproxy_balance_alg
whilst in juno it is hap_balance_alg.

Change-Id: I993e019c06f6d7ea7f77dc741d3d418e78ce2ca9
Closes-Bug: #1428081
Closes-Bug: #1429109

commit_message:
[IBP] fix apt sources and pinning for fuel-image

Now it could deal with space separated multiple entities in "section"
provided in "repos".

Eg.:
    "repos": [
        {
            "name": "ubuntu",
            "priority": 1001,
            "section": "main restricted universe multiverse",
            "suite": "trusty",
            "type": "deb",
            "uri": "http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/"
        },
     ]

Partially implements: blueprint ibp-build-ubuntu-images

Change-Id: I7c85de2df4e3e35a0b62b96692b7303254215e48

commit_message:
Use olso.config generator

Stop using the custom script to generate the sample configuration file
and use the oslo-config-generator function of oslo.config.

The change modified "genconfigs" function as a tox testenv (-egenconfigs),
to depend the on oslo-config-generator function of oslo.config.

<This is a modification of Lucas approach to test other possible approach
without including the whole lists of files with config files in
the opts.py file>

Missing: oslo log options until the release of the oslo.log library

Closes-Bug: #1384318

Change-Id: If09fc2b1a82527349fa238f00259856baca6371c
Co-Authored-By: Ghe Rivero <ghe.rivero@hp.com>

subject: Add common code to matchers
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-09 09:26:13.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tests/unit/test_matchers.py', 'oslotest/matchers.py', 'test-requirements-py3.txt'], 'message': 'Add common code to matchers

Several projects use the same matchers for dicts and XML files,
leading to code duplication. So far, this is included in
nova, keystone, ironic and trove projects.

This is the nova matchers file with pep8 clean and py33 fixes.
Other projects matchers, are just a copy (with minimal
divergences) or a subset of this one.

Change-Id: I915a74aa1b75367d3992819fb17b2f0d5d2a3eae
Partial-Bug: #1199536
'}]
commit_message:
Add common code to matchers

Several projects use the same matchers for dicts and XML files,
leading to code duplication. So far, this is included in
nova, keystone, ironic and trove projects.

This is the nova matchers file with pep8 clean and py33 fixes.
Other projects matchers, are just a copy (with minimal
divergences) or a subset of this one.

Change-Id: I915a74aa1b75367d3992819fb17b2f0d5d2a3eae
Partial-Bug: #1199536

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-11 13:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/objects/task.py', 'fuelclient/cli/actions/environment.py', 'fuelclient/cli/actions/release.py', 'fuelclient/objects/environment.py', 'fuelclient/cli/serializers.py', 'fuelclient/cli/actions/snapshot.py', 'fuelclient/objects/node.py', 'fuelclient/tests/test_snapshot.py'], 'message': 'Add commands to operate snapshot config

Added two commands to dump snapshot config
and provide it for snapshot task

Will download default config and dump it to stdout

fuel snapshot --conf > conf.yaml

Next command will accept config as input and bypass it to snapshot
generation request

fuel snapshot < conf.yaml

This is required to overwrite certain parameters if needed,
some of those are:
- target directory of snapshot generation
- timeout of snapshot generation procedure
- exclusion/inclusion of certain directories

Depends on I5e01a7459cefe49a128192d82dd827f02866f909
Related-Bug: 1382511
Related-Bug: 1420054
DocImpact

Change-Id: I1ddab26fba1346dad30955289e7d28f4d3aa1562
'}]
commit_message:
Add commands to operate snapshot config

Added two commands to dump snapshot config
and provide it for snapshot task

Will download default config and dump it to stdout

fuel snapshot --conf > conf.yaml

Next command will accept config as input and bypass it to snapshot
generation request

fuel snapshot < conf.yaml

This is required to overwrite certain parameters if needed,
some of those are:
- target directory of snapshot generation
- timeout of snapshot generation procedure
- exclusion/inclusion of certain directories

Depends on I5e01a7459cefe49a128192d82dd827f02866f909
Related-Bug: 1382511
Related-Bug: 1420054
DocImpact

Change-Id: I1ddab26fba1346dad30955289e7d28f4d3aa1562

commit_message:
Make resource creation fail when no 'id' in manifest

This patch makes resource pod/rc/service creation
return 400 status when 'id' field is not passed in
manifest.

Change-Id: I1fa141b9be31788f7956c5b428d7591bc44623dd
Closes-bug: #1430685

commit_message:
Add catch FlavorExtraSpecsNotFound in V2 API.

we catch FlavorExtraSpecsNotFound in v3 API but we didn't catch it
at v2 API. This patch adds it and no need to add unit test
because v2 v3 share unit test.

In oslo.messaging to identify a "rpc server" we have to set the

commit_message:
Change the engine-listener topic

In oslo.messaging to identify a "rpc server" we have to set the
server attribut of the target. But currently, the engine-listener uses
the hostname of the host, that make all workers on the host to be
identified has same "rpc server" by oslo.messaging, by chance because
heat uses a different topics for each workers, that works.

This change uses the engine id instead of the hostname to identify the
"rpc server" and use the same topic for all engine listeners.

Related-bug: #1414674

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/service.py

Change-Id: I359709ab15ee24ac2459826264adf2373dbb067f
(cherry-picked from commit 9b27efc910695d1be92f2c293d5d11e35e9637f3)

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-03-04 17:56:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_interface.py', 'neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Avoid unnecessarily checking the existence of a device

Plugging a device usually involves checking for the existence of the
device twice, once before calling plug and once after.  It turns out
that these calls are expensive, often taking a half second or more
each.  For that reason, it is worth the effort to make sure we check
only once.

The device driver is now responsible for cleanly plugging/unplugging
the device without knowing whether it exists or not.  Pushing this
responsibility to the device driver allows implementing it more
efficiently in terms of calls made out to the operating system.

This is targetted at the neutron-tempest-parallel bp because it shaves
time off the time to set up a router, something that hinders parallel
performance.

Change-Id: I391fafe68b76e1c620d2b25e8613ba507fd25dfd
Partial-Bug: #1287824
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessarily checking the existence of a device

Plugging a device usually involves checking for the existence of the
device twice, once before calling plug and once after.  It turns out
that these calls are expensive, often taking a half second or more
each.  For that reason, it is worth the effort to make sure we check
only once.

The device driver is now responsible for cleanly plugging/unplugging
the device without knowing whether it exists or not.  Pushing this
responsibility to the device driver allows implementing it more
efficiently in terms of calls made out to the operating system.

This is targetted at the neutron-tempest-parallel bp because it shaves
time off the time to set up a router, something that hinders parallel
performance.

Change-Id: I391fafe68b76e1c620d2b25e8613ba507fd25dfd
Partial-Bug: #1287824

commit_message:
Retry requests in scheduler to wait for metrics

This patch adds an interval equal to periodic_interval before
scheduling a volume if request was received between scheduler
service startup and periodic tasks interval. During this time calls to
scheduler_driver are retried till a successful one is resumed or
delay passes. This is to prevent from failing requests received in
that time window due to lack of volume stats.

I also made changes to test_pure to get rid of global monkey patching
of utils.retry decorator which caused problems with writing tests to
this patch.

Change-Id: Iadc6c3a316c7bf3d4f9fd074d76e290b45eae334
Closes-Bug: 1409012

Use the command *ip netns pids* in Neutron OCF scripts

Use command *ip netns pids* instead of lsof. This decreases the time of
getting pids inside namespace. Profit >20 times faster then with lsof.

Change-Id: Ife3f5da3558bf4b5ddd0abbe997cd4b845a8d53c
Closes-bug: #1405477

  master_ip as parameter, so there's no need to pull it via hiera
  inside the class

commit_message:
New tasks for Horizon, API-proxy and Ceph radosgw

* move Horizon, API proxy and radosgw setup from
  openstack::controller to separate tasks
* minor refactoring of some ceph manifests to allow separate
  ceph::radosgw declaration
* fixing mistake in osnailyfacter::apache_api_proxy - we pass
  master_ip as parameter, so there's no need to pull it via hiera
  inside the class
* fixing warning from api_proxy.conf.erb template

Change-Id: I03810ed51ae015ac64dde6e82ce2f721a42f45d3
Related-Blueprint: fuel-library-modularization

commit_message:
Add scope info to initiator data for CADF notifications

the project id (or domain id) is important information to audit,
as such, it should be added to the initiator block of a CADF
notification.

Change-Id: I7d73f671130485e449820d7f6d38a25c3bbc05bf
Closes-Bug: 1428945

commit_message:
Add support to the services decorator for trove

The services decorator previously didn't have support for trove. While
nothing is using it right now it's conceivable in the future. This
commit adds it to the list.

Change-Id: I5c30da6a19243857adf4f19f77181a2545105c21

commit_message:
Add dependency on Router External Gateway property

FIP has dependecy for RouterGateway resource, but it was deperecated in
favor of Router property. So we should add corrsponding dependency for
FIP resource.

Change-Id: I5c45ddc96b17bb1f87188ae3e9aabf74e6e29e1d
Closes-Bug: #1399699
(cherry picked from commit 38d1b4fada3bf1f52547103a311f7ac9e27a04b4)

subject: Use only FIP dependencies from graph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-03 14:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/neutron/floatingip.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron.py'], 'message': 'Use only FIP dependencies from graph

This patch contains follow important changes:
 - Fix wrong parameter passsed in graph method.
 - Now we use only FIP dependencies from graph.
 - Tests were fixed according to correct logic. Previously we try to add
   router interface to FIP dependecies, when FIPAssociation was defined
   in template. It was incorrect, because in this case such dependecy
   should be added to FIPAssociation insteaf of FIP resource.

Change-Id: I0ee15b80627783fc2a4c037060629e3c2f364b82
Closes-Bug: #1399713
(cherry picked from commit 64a301c5b2555aa04fb78925ef91321bdfa2e174)
'}]
commit_message:
Use only FIP dependencies from graph

This patch contains follow important changes:
 - Fix wrong parameter passsed in graph method.
 - Now we use only FIP dependencies from graph.
 - Tests were fixed according to correct logic. Previously we try to add
   router interface to FIP dependecies, when FIPAssociation was defined
   in template. It was incorrect, because in this case such dependecy
   should be added to FIPAssociation insteaf of FIP resource.

Change-Id: I0ee15b80627783fc2a4c037060629e3c2f364b82
Closes-Bug: #1399713
(cherry picked from commit 64a301c5b2555aa04fb78925ef91321bdfa2e174)

commit_message:
Add support for additional identity events

Keystone has started to emit events for CRUD events on more
resources, specifically: regions, policy, endpoint and service.

Change-Id: I6d5f21474dd8f7694ea28b91544ad93c0b421bf9
Closes-Bug: 1429337

commit_message:
Remove redundant creation timestamp from fernet tokens

This removes the creation timestamp from the token's payload in favor of
extracting the token's creation timestamp from the Fernet token format
itself.

Change-Id: I170a07adc1fe6418dfaf2c78e1b439339f1c14ed
Closes-Bug: 1428717

commit_message:
Namespace updates for _i18n and imageutils & fileutils

The _i18n and imageutils modules only have changes
to move oslo.utils to the oslo_utils namespace and
oslo.i18n to oslo_i18n.  So, I have lumped these
two small changes into this one patch.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit e589dde0721a0a67e4030813e582afec6e70d042
Date:  Wed Feb 18 03:08:12 2015 +0000
Merge "Have a little fun with release notes"

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
_i18n.py
  0cc741a9 - switch to oslo_i18n
imageutils.py
  ac17de97 - Use oslo_utils instead of deprecated oslo.utils
fileutils.py
  ac17de97 - Use oslo_utils instead of deprecated oslo.utils

Change-Id: I749dd8869bbc07d980300e0acbf3903ff7b297cd

commit_message:
linuxbridge UT: Mock get_interface_by_ip

To avoid querying devices on the system running UT,
which might or might not work.

The regression was introduced by
commit b7a56fd1b44649daa1f768157e68a135b9e01dd1 .

Closes-Bug: #1430098
Change-Id: I2dcdf4b9516e0a90dffee26684fdce7f0ce43cd8

commit_message:
Avoid httpretty 0.8.8 as it can break unittests

A hanging issue was occurring with httpretty 0.8.8 when testing
openstack/python-ironicclient.

    * Blacklist 0.8.8

The underlying issue appears to be tracked in this bug:
    https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/issues/221

Change-Id: I6b63d4b9966c30d7d1d4d287b156f85f0b78f602

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 06:54:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Hard delete orphan compute nodes

Orphan compute nodes is soft deleted by compute manager currently. However,
commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/126372/ adds a new constrain which
prevents resource tracker to insert new compute node record  whose host and
hypervisor_hostname are duplicated with those soft deleted records. So that
Nova compute manager will fails to start, if it attempts to loads a driver
which is used to be loaded on the same host. Need to hard delete those orphan
compute nodes, in order to avoid duplication.

Change-Id: Ic0511a4737c35fa40caad7c10eccbf0008f6312f
Closes-Bug: 1417744
'}]
commit_message:
Hard delete orphan compute nodes

Orphan compute nodes is soft deleted by compute manager currently. However,
commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/126372/ adds a new constrain which
prevents resource tracker to insert new compute node record  whose host and
hypervisor_hostname are duplicated with those soft deleted records. So that
Nova compute manager will fails to start, if it attempts to loads a driver
which is used to be loaded on the same host. Need to hard delete those orphan
compute nodes, in order to avoid duplication.

Change-Id: Ic0511a4737c35fa40caad7c10eccbf0008f6312f
Closes-Bug: 1417744

commit_message:
Arista L3 Service Plugin decomposition

Moving back-end drivers of Arista L3
Service Plugin from neutron tree to
stackforge networking-arista.

Change-Id: I0b10ce12bc10fb74c905ec11e64be8da12f341f4
Closes-bug: 1428909
Related-blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_delete/service_get

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_delete and service_get.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call this methods which
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code
permission.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: Ie87d6393cd89f87a1e04a820fa01421055b0b348

commit_message:
Immediately schedule net to a DHCP agt by default

Change the DHCP scheduler behavior to avoid deferring
the scheduling of networks to DHCP agents. By default,
now DHCP agents will react to the network creation event
and immediately create a port.

Change-Id: I1c1caed0fdda6b801375a07f9252a9127058a07e

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_update

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_update.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call those calls
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code
permission.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: Ia70028c129588ea8a764196c7f6260beb936e2e1

commit_message:
Fix NotImplementedError handling in interfaces API

attach_interfaces used format_message() of NotImplementedError for
getting message, but NotImplementedError doesn't contain it then
AttributeError happened. This patch fixes this problem.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I2153756a88f67820821e66a494b892e3017ad788

subject: Prefer policy to policy_index
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-10 17:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/info.py', 'swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/common/test_request_helpers.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'swift/obj/mem_server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/mem_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_sender.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/obj/updater.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "Prefer policy to policy_index

When a policy must be associated with an operation (particularly in a
method/function signature), adopt the convention of using the policy
instance (instead of just the policy_index).

This puts the earnest on the caller to make the decision if it can
safely assume the legacy policy was intended.

 * added StoragePolicyCollection.legacy property to name the legacy Policy-0

On the wire operations will still prefer the policy_index (normally
provided in the X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index header).  If the called
service can not translate the provided policy index to a valid policy it
should return a client error.

 * object-server will return Bad Request for unknown policy

The DiskFile API now requires ObjectController.get_diskfile to accept
the policy instead of the policy_index.  Implementations of DiskFile
that previously expected the policy_idx keyword parameter will need to
be modified to accept the policy instance.  It is still possible to
ignore policy (e.g.  swift.obj.mem_diskfile), but creating a
swift.obj.diskfile.DiskFile always requires a policy and will raise a
TypeError if called directly with policy=None.

The Auditor will skip audit locations for unknown policies (like the
updater and replicator) to avoid potentially quarantining objects it
doesn't know how how to property audit - it will still log a warning
when it encounters a datadir for an unknown policy - but it will not
attempt to audit locations in that datadir.

Change-Id: I81e9cc8492d642e6df5c822d95a48fe4c96caee1
"}]
commit_message:
Prefer policy to policy_index

When a policy must be associated with an operation (particularly in a
method/function signature), adopt the convention of using the policy
instance (instead of just the policy_index).

This puts the earnest on the caller to make the decision if it can
safely assume the legacy policy was intended.

 * added StoragePolicyCollection.legacy property to name the legacy Policy-0

On the wire operations will still prefer the policy_index (normally
provided in the X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index header).  If the called
service can not translate the provided policy index to a valid policy it
should return a client error.

 * object-server will return Bad Request for unknown policy

The DiskFile API now requires ObjectController.get_diskfile to accept
the policy instead of the policy_index.  Implementations of DiskFile
that previously expected the policy_idx keyword parameter will need to
be modified to accept the policy instance.  It is still possible to
ignore policy (e.g.  swift.obj.mem_diskfile), but creating a
swift.obj.diskfile.DiskFile always requires a policy and will raise a
TypeError if called directly with policy=None.

The Auditor will skip audit locations for unknown policies (like the
updater and replicator) to avoid potentially quarantining objects it
doesn't know how how to property audit - it will still log a warning
when it encounters a datadir for an unknown policy - but it will not
attempt to audit locations in that datadir.

Change-Id: I81e9cc8492d642e6df5c822d95a48fe4c96caee1

commit_message:
Split out and refactored more secret tests

This is a continuation of the refactor effort of test resources.
Also removed invalid bit test due to it being an impossible scenario.
This should increase readability and remove a reliance on magic mock.

Change-Id: I60fbc1b1839e44ac648266f0e970ac507dcd523b

subject: Fix create orders functional tests for asynchronous order processing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 23:04:56.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_orders.py'], 'message': 'Fix create orders functional tests for asynchronous order processing

Two of the order functional tests would fail when barbican was deployed
with a queue due to a race condition. This causes them to loop and poll
for a few seconds to let the order process.

Change-Id: I7e7c059a9ca81172a609ef46deae43447300ebac
'}]
commit_message:
Fix create orders functional tests for asynchronous order processing

Two of the order functional tests would fail when barbican was deployed
with a queue due to a race condition. This causes them to loop and poll
for a few seconds to let the order process.

Change-Id: I7e7c059a9ca81172a609ef46deae43447300ebac

Closes-Bug: #1424661
'}]
commit_message:
Removing networks from offline DHCP agents

This patch adds information on the ability to configure
networks to automatically uncouple from DHCP agents
after the agents are offline, or deactivated.

Change-Id: I2f8ce9e2513345c4d31cfc05176dc5d28541bdab
backport: none
Closes-Bug: #1424661

commit_message:
Comment `log_file` for Zaqar

Instead of logging to a file, let it use stdout so we can see the output
in the screen logs.

Change-Id: I0e5e12a6ddc5ad91dd37e97362ac9a5bed238e32
